archaeopolis: <entryFree id="n3415" type="main" key="Archaeo^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Archaeŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arxaio/polis</foreign>, <sense id="n3415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Lydia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archangelus: <entryFree id="n3416" type="greek" key="archange^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archangĕlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxa/ggelos</foreign>, <sense id="n3416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an archangel</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,013:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Thess. 4, 15</bibl>; ib. Judas, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ruf. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arche: <entryFree id="n3417" type="greek" key="arche_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxh/</foreign> (beginning). <sense id="n3417.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Æons of Valentinus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3417.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Archē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">one of the four muses; a daughter of the younger Jupiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archelaus: <entryFree id="n3418" type="main" key="Arche^la_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Archĕlāus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arxe/laos</foreign>. <sense id="n3418.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A philosopher of Miletus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pupil of Anaxagoras</hi>, <cb n="ARCH" /> <hi rend="ital">and teacher of Socrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3418.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Perdiccas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and friend of Euripides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:20:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 20, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3418.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Cappadocia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the time of Tiberius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and author of a work</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">*i*ieri\ li/qwn</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 11, § 46</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —</sense><sense id="n3418.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A general of Mithridates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1, 4 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3418.4" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">His son</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the rival of King Ptolemy Auletes of Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Gabinius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archeota: <entryFree id="n3419" type="greek" key="arche_o_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archēōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxeiw/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n3419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a keeper of the archives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a recorder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archetypus: <entryFree id="n3420" type="greek" key="arche^ty^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĕtypus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxe/tupos</foreign>, <sense id="n3420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that was first made</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">archetypos servare Cleanthas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the original statues of Cleanthes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>. So Martial calls the original MSS. of his epigrams, archetypae nugae, 7, 11, and in jest, friends that cost nothing, archetypi amici, 12, 69.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">archĕty-pum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an original</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 8</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archezostis: <entryFree id="n3421" type="main" key="arche_zo_stis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archēzōstis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bryony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> ampeloleuce: Bryonia alba, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archias: <entryFree id="n3422" type="main" key="Archi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Archĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arxi/as</foreign>. <sense id="n3422.0" n="I" level="1"> Aulus Licinius, <hi rend="ital">a Greek poet of Antiochia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who became distinguished by Cicero's defence of him;</hi> v. Cic. Or. pro Archia.—</sense><sense id="n3422.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cabinet-maker;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Archiăcus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: lecti, <hi rend="ital">a couch made by Archias</hi>, and from the context, <hi rend="ital">a plain couch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archiatria: <entryFree id="n3423" type="gloss" key="archi^a_^tri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭā^trĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*a*r*x*i*a*t*r*i*a</foreign>, <sense id="n3423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rank of chief physician</hi>, Cod. Th. 13, 3, 8.</sense></entryFree>
archiatrus: <entryFree id="n3424" type="greek" key="archi^a_^trus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭā^trus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxi/atros</foreign>; in the time of the emperors, <sense id="n3424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief physician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was at the same time physician in ordinary to the emperor</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 13; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3994</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4017</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4226 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
archibuculus: <entryFree id="n3425" type="gloss" key="archi^bu_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭbūcŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-būcŏl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxi-bou/kolos</foreign>, <sense id="n3425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief priest of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2335</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2351</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2352</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archidiaconus: <entryFree id="n3426" type="greek" key="archi^di^a_co^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭdĭācŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxidia/konos</foreign>, <sense id="n3426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an archdeacon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Pamm. Ep. 61, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archiepiscopus: <entryFree id="n3427" type="greek" key="archi^e^pisco^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭĕpiscŏpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxiepi/skopos</foreign>, <sense id="n3427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an archbishop</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archiereus: <entryFree id="n3428" type="greek" key="archi^e^reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭĕreus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxiereu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief priest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2543</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2627</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archierosyna: <entryFree id="n3429" type="greek" key="archi^e^ro_sy^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭĕrōsyna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxiepwsu/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n3429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief priest's office</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 1, 112.</sense></entryFree>
archigallus: <entryFree id="n3430" type="main" key="archi^gallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭgallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*a*r*x*i*g*a*l*l*o*s</foreign> (cf. Gallus), <sense id="n3430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief priest of Cybele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2320 sq.</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
archigeron: <entryFree id="n3431" type="main" key="archi^ge^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭgĕron</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*a*r*x*i*g*e*r*w*n</foreign>, <sense id="n3431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chief of the old men</hi>, a title under the emperors, Cod. Th. 14, 27, 1.</sense></entryFree>
archigubernus: <entryFree id="n3432" type="greek" key="archi^gu^bernus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭgŭbernus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*a*r*x*i*k*u*b*e*r*n*o*s</foreign>, <sense id="n3432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chief pilot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">helmsman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3634</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archilochus: <entryFree id="n3433" type="main" key="Archi^lo^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Archĭlŏchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arxi/loxos</foreign>, <sense id="n3433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek poet of Paros</hi>, who, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 3</bibl>, lived in the age of Romulus; but, acc. to Nep. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 8</bibl>, was a contemporary of Tullus Hostilius; <cit><quote lang="la">he was the originator of iambic verse, and the author of very bitter satires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 23 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 79</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 60</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Archĭ-lŏchīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Archilochian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 509 sq.</bibl></cit> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 1819 sq.</bibl> P.; also an appel. for <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acrimonius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
archimagirus: <entryFree id="n3434" type="greek" key="archi^ma^gi_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭmăgīrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxima/geiros</foreign>, <sense id="n3434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief cook</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:109" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archimandrita: <entryFree id="n3435" type="greek" key="archi^mandri_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭmandrīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rximandri/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n3435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief</hi> or <hi rend="ital">principal of monks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an abbot</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archimedes: <entryFree id="n3436" type="main" key="Archi^me_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Archĭmēdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n3436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Archimedi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14, 22</bibl>; cf. Schne<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gr. II. 163 sq.</bibl>; Rudd. I. p. 58, n. 71; Neue, Formenl. I. p. 333; <case>acc.</case> Archimeden, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:58:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 58, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 31, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archimedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 64</bibl></cit>; Neue, Formenl. I. p. 309 sq.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arximh/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated mathematician of Syracuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with his burning-glasses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set fire to the ships of the Roman besiegers of his native city</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 50</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">his monument, before unknown, was discovered by Cicero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Archĭmēdēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Archimedian</hi>: manus,<cb n="ARCI" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, p. 191</bibl>: loculus, Marc. Vict. p. 2547 P.</sense></entryFree>
archimimus: <entryFree id="n3437" type="greek" key="archi^mi_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭmīmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxi/mimos</foreign>, <sense id="n3437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chief mimic actor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pantomime</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2625</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> ARCHIMIMA, ae, <hi rend="ital">chief mimic actress</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4760</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archipirata: <entryFree id="n3438" type="greek" key="archi^pi_ra_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭpīrāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxipeirath/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader of pirates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archipresbyter: <entryFree id="n3439" type="greek" key="archi^presby^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭpresbyter</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxipresbu/teros</foreign>, <sense id="n3439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief of the</hi> presbyteri, <hi rend="ital">arch-priest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 4</bibl> ad Rustic.</sense></entryFree>
archisacerdos: <entryFree id="n3440" type="main" key="archi^sa^cerdos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭ-săcerdos</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hybrida</etym>, <sense id="n3440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chief priest</hi>, Ven. Carm. 3, 13, 1.</sense></entryFree>
archisynagogus: <entryFree id="n3441" type="main" key="archi^sy^na^go_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭsynăgōgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxisuna/gwgos</foreign>, <sense id="n3441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the priest that was chief ruler of the synagogue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 13, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:18:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 18, 8 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Cod. Th. 16, 8, 13 al.</sense></entryFree>
architecta: <entryFree id="n3442" type="main" key="archi^tecta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭtecta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. architectus, I. B.</entryFree>
architecton: <entryFree id="n3443" type="main" key="archi^tecton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭtecton</orth>, v. architectus, II.</entryFree>
architectonice: <entryFree id="n3444" type="greek" key="archi^tecto^ni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭtectŏnĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxitektonikh/</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">te/xnh</foreign>), <sense id="n3444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">architecture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
architectonicus: <entryFree id="n3445" type="greek" key="archi^tecto^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭtectŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxitektoniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to architecture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
architector: <entryFree id="n3446" type="main" key="archi^tector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭtector</orth>, <itype>ātus, āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>architectus</etym>. <sense id="n3446.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to build</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi> (rare): situm loci cujusdam ad suum arbitrium fabricari et architectari, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 3, 19, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, praef. 17: <cit><quote lang="la">cardines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3446.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 52</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 32</bibl>: Epicurus architectus beatae vitae).!*? <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: Aedes Martis architectata ab Hermodoro Salaminio, <foreign lang="greek">a)rxitektoneuqei=sa</foreign>, Nep. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
architectura: <entryFree id="n3447" type="main" key="archi^tectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭtectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">architecture</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxitektoni/a</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n3447.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3447.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of historical representation: <cit><quote lang="la">Specus ipsa quā concameratur architecturā!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
architectus: <entryFree id="n3448" type="greek" key="archi^tectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭtectus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxite/ktwn</foreign> (the usual form, while † <orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭtecton</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, is rare). <sense id="n3448.0" n="I" level="1"> Form architectus. </sense><sense id="n3448.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A master-builder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">architect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabri architectique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philo architectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 62</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 42, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:38:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 38, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Macc. 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sapiens architectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Cor. 3, 10</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n3448.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an inventor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deviser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contriver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene factis Juppiter architectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 45</bibl></cit> ( = auctor atque opifex, Lambin.): <cit><quote lang="la">inventor veritatis et quasi architectus beatae vitae Epicurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">architectari voluptates): princeps atque architectus sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoici architecti paene verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 31, 118</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭtecta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female architect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura architecta vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 71, 91, § 196</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3448.3" n="II" level="1"> Form architecton. </sense><sense id="n3448.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A master-builder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">architect</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam sibi laudavisse hasce ait architectonem, Nescio quem, esse aedificatas has sane bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3448.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a master in cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a crafty man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me quoque dolis jam superat architectonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 150</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
architis: <entryFree id="n3449" type="gloss" key="Archi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Archītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of Venus among the Assyrians</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
architriclinus: <entryFree id="n3450" type="main" key="archi^tricli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archĭ-triclīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hybrida; triclinium</etym>, = tricliniarcha, <sense id="n3450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that presides at the table</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the master of a feast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">bis.</hi></sense></entryFree>
archium: <entryFree id="n3451" type="greek" key="archi_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archīum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">archīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rxei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n3451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the archives</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:9:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 9, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquissimarum gentium archiva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
archon: <entryFree id="n3452" type="greek" key="archo_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">archōn</orth>, <itype>ōntis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/rxwn</foreign> (a ruler), <sense id="n3452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the highest magistrate at Athens after the abrogation of royal authority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an archon</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2</bibl> and 8.</sense></entryFree>
archytas: <entryFree id="n3453" type="main" key="Archy_tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Archȳtas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>nom.</case> Archytă, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 176</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)arxu/tas</foreign>, <sense id="n3453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Pythagorean philosopher of Tarentum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and friend of Plato</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:36:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 36, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 23, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7</bibl>, praef. 14 and 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcifinalis: <entryFree id="n3454" type="main" key="arci^fi_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcĭfīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">arcĭfīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <pb n="155" /> <cb n="ARCU" /> <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arceo - finis</etym>; among surveyors, agri, <sense id="n3454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lands received in possession and built upon by victors after expelling the previous owners</hi> (whence the term), Sic. Fl. p. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=38" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 38</bibl>; Hyg Lim. p. 160. Defined otherwise by <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcion: <entryFree id="n3455" type="greek" key="arci_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcīon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rkei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n3455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi> (in pure Lat., persollata), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 66, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcipotens: <entryFree id="n3456" type="hapax" key="Arci^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcĭ-pŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arcus</etym>, <sense id="n3456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skilful with the bow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a skilful archer</hi>, an epithet of Apollo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:17" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcirma: <entryFree id="n3457" type="gloss" key="arcirma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcirma</orth> (this is the correct read., not <orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭma</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arcera</etym>, <sense id="n3457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small carriage</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 15</bibl> Müll.; v. Müll. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
arcitenens: <entryFree id="n3458" type="main" key="Arci^te^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcĭ-tĕnens</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">arquĭtĕ-nens</orth>, <itype>like arquus for arcus, quur for cur</itype>, etc.), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arcus-teneo</etym>, <sense id="n3458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carrying a bow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bow-bearing</hi>, in imitation of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*tozofo/ros</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n3458.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of Apollo and of Diana;</hi> of Apollo, Naev. Bell. Pun. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5</bibl> (p. 14 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 441</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:61" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 61</bibl>: Phoebus fulgente decorus arcu); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 265</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pius Arcitenens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 75</bibl></cit> (Apollinem dicit, Serv.): Arquitenens dea, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 341, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arquitenentes Diana et Apollo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3458.2" n="II" level="1"> As a constellation, <hi rend="ital">the Archer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:Phaen. 405" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. Phaen. 405</bibl> B. and K.</sense></entryFree>
arcte: <entryFree id="n3459" type="main" key="arcte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arctē</orth> (correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">artē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. artus <sense id="n3459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
arcticus: <entryFree id="n3460" type="greek" key="arcti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arctĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rktiko/s</foreign> (pertaining to the constellation of the Bear, <foreign lang="greek">a)/rktos</foreign>; hence), <sense id="n3460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">northern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arctic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arction: <entryFree id="n3461" type="greek" key="arcti^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arctĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/rktion</foreign>, <sense id="n3461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> arcturus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 5, 16, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcto: <entryFree id="n3462" type="main" key="arcto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcto</orth>, v. arto <sense id="n3462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
arctophylax: <entryFree id="n3463" type="greek" key="Arcto^phy^lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arctŏphylax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arktofu/lac</foreign>, <sense id="n3463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Bear-keeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, usu. called Bootes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:Phaen. 394" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. Phaen. 394</bibl> B. and K.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:42:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 42, 109</bibl> (as transl. from Arat. 92); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arctophyllum: <entryFree id="n3464" type="main" key="arcto^phyllum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arctŏphyllum</orth>, v. caerefolium.</entryFree>
arctos: <entryFree id="n3465" type="greek" key="arcto^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arctŏs</orth> (<case>nom.</case> arctos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 246</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> arcton, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:192" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 138</bibl>: <sense id="n3465.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">arctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:42:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 42, 109</bibl></cit> (in verse); <hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> arctoe (as in Ter. Adelphoe for Adelphi), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:41:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 41, 105</bibl>, and Arat. Phaen. 441 B. and K.; C. <bibl default="NO"><author>German.</author> Arat. 25</bibl> and 63), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (cf. Rudd. I. p. 27; Neue, Formenl. I. pp. 650 sq.; 129; 131), = <foreign lang="greek">a)/rktos</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n3465.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the Great and the Lesser Bear</hi> (Ursa Major et Minor; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: ursa, plaustrum, Septentrio), a double constellation (hence, geminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15, 25</bibl>) in the vicinity of the north pole; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 1 sq.</bibl> Among the poets, on account of its place in the north, gelidae arcti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 625</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and since it never sets to our hemisphere, immunis aequoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequoris expers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:727" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuens aequore tingui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 246</bibl></cit> (an imitation of the Homeric: <foreign lang="greek">a)/mmoros loetrw=n *)wkeanoi=o</foreign>, Il. 18, 489; Od. 5, 275; cf. also Arat. Phaen. 48: <foreign lang="greek">*)/arktoi kuane/ou pefulagme/nai *)wkeanoi=o</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n3465.2" n="II" level="1"> Metaph. </sense><sense id="n3465.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The north pole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3465.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The night</hi> (cf. luna), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3465.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The people dwelling in the north</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post domitas Arctos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 246</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 336</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3465.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The north wind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arctous: <entryFree id="n3466" type="greek" key="arcto_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arctōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rktw=|os</foreign>, prop., <sense id="n3466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to</hi> arctos (q. v.); hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">northern</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">arcticus, aquilonius, Borealis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:68" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:6:2" default="NO">10, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:250" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 250</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 604" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 604</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1566" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 1566</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcturus: <entryFree id="n3467" type="greek" key="arctu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arctūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rktou=ros</foreign>. <sense id="n3467.0" n="I" level="1"> As a star. </sense><sense id="n3467.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The brightest star in Bootes</hi>,, <hi rend="ital">whose rising and setting was supposed to portend tempestuous weather</hi> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 71</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">stella micans radiis, Arcturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:42:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 42, 110</bibl> (as a transl. of Arat. 95); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 130" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 744</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37, 9</bibl>; ib. Amos, 5, 8; introduced in Plaut. Rud. as Prologus.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3467.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The whole constellation</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">Bootes, Arctophylax),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 204</bibl></cit> Voss.—</sense><sense id="n3467.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The rising of Arcturus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3467.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, v. arction.</sense></entryFree>
arctus: <entryFree id="n3468" type="main" key="arctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arctus</orth>, <itype>a, um, for artus</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n3469" type="main" key="arctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arctus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. arctos.</entryFree>
arcuarius: <entryFree id="n3470" type="main" key="arcu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arcus</etym>, <sense id="n3470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the bow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabricae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 11</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭārius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a maker of bows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>. <cb n="ARCU" /></sense></entryFree>
arcuatilis: <entryFree id="n3471" type="hapax" key="arcu^a_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arcuo</etym>, <sense id="n3471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bow-formed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caminus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. arcuatim.</sense></entryFree>
arcuatim: <entryFree id="n3472" type="main" key="arcu^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the form of a bow</hi> (perh. only in the foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">millepeda animal multis pedibus arcuatim repens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 136</bibl></cit>: sanguis arcuatim fluens, Fest. s. v. Tullios, p. 352 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
arcuatio: <entryFree id="n3473" type="hapax" key="arcu^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an arch</hi> (only in Front.), Aquaed. 18; 121.</sense></entryFree>
arcuatus: <entryFree id="n3474" type="main" key="arcu^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭātus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n3474.0" n="I" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood> of arcuo.— </sense><sense id="n3474.1" n="II" level="1"> = arquatus, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
arcuballista: <entryFree id="n3475" type="main" key="arcu^ballista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭ-ballista</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">balista</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arcus</etym>, <sense id="n3475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ballista furnished with a bow;</hi> only <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcuballistarius: <entryFree id="n3476" type="hapax" key="arcu^ballista_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭballistārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">balist-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>arcuballista</etym>, <sense id="n3476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that shoots with an</hi> arcuballista, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcubii: <entryFree id="n3477" type="gloss" key="arcubii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcubii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: qui excubabant in arce [ar, = ad, and cubo], Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=25" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 25</bibl> Müll.; cf. Doed. Syn. II. p. 162.</entryFree>
arcula: <entryFree id="n3478" type="main" key="arcu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>arca</etym>, <sense id="n3478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small chest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">box</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a casket</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n3478.1" n="I" level="1"> For unguents, ornaments, etc. </sense><sense id="n3478.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small perfume - box</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a jewel-casket</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arculae muliebres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, trop. of rhetor. ornament: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes (Isocratis) discipulorum arculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3478.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small money-box</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casket</hi>: arcula plena aranearum, Afran. ap. Fest. s. v. tanne, p. 154 (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 13, 8</bibl>: Plenus sacculus est aranearum). —</sense><sense id="n3478.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wind-box of an organ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3478.5" n="III" level="1"> Arcula dicebatur avis, quae in auspiciis vetabat aliquid fieri, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 16</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
arcularius: <entryFree id="n3479" type="hapax" key="arcu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>arcula</etym> <sense id="n3479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that makes little boxes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jewel - caskets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arculata: <entryFree id="n3480" type="gloss" key="arcu^la_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭlāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Arculus</etym>, <sense id="n3480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sacrificial cakes made of flour</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 16</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
arculum: <entryFree id="n3481" type="gloss" key="arcu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>arcus</etym>, <sense id="n3481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a roll</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hoop placed upon the head for the purpose of carrying the vessels at public sacrifices</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 16</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
arculus: <entryFree id="n3482" type="gloss" key="Arcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>arca</etym>, <sense id="n3482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of chests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coffers</hi>, etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 16</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
arcuma: <entryFree id="n3483" type="gloss" key="arcu^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. arcirma.</entryFree>
arcuo: <entryFree id="n3484" type="main" key="arcu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>arcus</etym>, <sense id="n3484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make in the form of a bow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">curve like a bow</hi> (not before the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">curru arcuato vehi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>covered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 46, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(millepeda) quae non arcuatur,</quote> <trans><tr>does not bend itself in the form of a bow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 137</bibl></cit> (cf. arcuatim); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 590</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arcus: <entryFree id="n3485" type="main" key="arcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arcus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (the orthography, arquus (cf. arquatus), is freq. in MSS., like quum for cum, quur for cur, etc.; cf. Freund ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:page=31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. p. 31 sq.</bibl> Thus <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 92</bibl> P. upon <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 51</bibl>, reads arcuis; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 712</bibl> P. arci; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 425, 5</bibl>, upon <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 526</bibl>, arqui; but the distinction which the latter gram. points out (arcus suspensus fornix appellatur; arquus non nisi qui in caelo apparet, quam Irim poëtae dixerunt) does not seem to be well founded.—<sense id="n3485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Abl. plur.</hi> never found; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to the gram., Don. p. 1751,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 285</bibl></cit>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 779</bibl>, Rhem. Palaem. p. 1371 P. al., it was arcubus; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Esdr. 4, 13; cf. Rudd. I. p. 104, n. 48.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. sing.</hi> arqui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 526</bibl> Lachm., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 51</bibl> B. and K.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> arcu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:18" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 18</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Nom. plur.</hi> ARCVVS, Corp. Inscr. V. 85; Inscr. Henz. 5313: arci, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 77, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> ARCOS, Corp. Inscr. II. 3420.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 712</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 658</bibl> P.; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. 6, 610</bibl>, says that Catull. and others used it as <hi rend="ital">fem.;</hi> v. Neue, Formenl. I. p. 679) [cf. Sanscr. arālas = bent, the bent arm, aratnis = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">w)le/nh</foreign>; Lat. ulna; Germ. Elbogen; Engl. elbow. Curt.], prop., <hi rend="ital">something bent;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n3485.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bow</hi> (syn. cornu). </sense><sense id="n3485.2" n="A" level="2"> For shooting: intendit crinitus Apollo Arcum auratum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl> (Trag. v. 54 Müll.): <cit><quote lang="la">arcus intentus in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cernens arcum intendebat Apollo Desuper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 704</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 665</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">36, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcum tendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:22:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 3 Reg. 22, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 4 Reg. 9, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcum dirigere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:60" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom arcum et pharetram mi et sagittas sumpsero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 98</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arcum suscitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,043:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Hab. 3, 9</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n3485.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The rainbow</hi> (fully: pluvius arcus, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, II.), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 712</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 393 Vahl.): Tum color in nigris existit <cb n="ARDE" /> nubibus arqui, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 526</bibl> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus ipse ex nubibus efficitur quodam modo coloratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu nubibus arcus Mille jacit varios adverso sole colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 88</bibl></cit> Rib.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 632</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 838</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluvius describitur arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 80, § 353</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 5</bibl> and 6: <cit><quote lang="la">arcum meum ponam in nubibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 9, 13</bibl></cit> sqq. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 1</bibl>, iris, q. v.) al.—</sense><sense id="n3485.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arch in building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triumphal arch</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">efficiens humilem lapidum compagibus arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmoreus arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:59:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 59, 2</bibl> Schwarz.—</sense><sense id="n3485.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3485.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose, <hi rend="ital">any thing arched</hi> or <hi rend="ital">curved like a bow;</hi> of the breaking of waves: <cit><quote lang="la">niger arcus aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 568</bibl></cit>.—Of the windings of a serpent: <cit><quote lang="la">immensos saltu sinuatur in arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 42</bibl></cit>.—Of a curve in flight: <cit><quote lang="la">dea se paribus per cælum sustulit alis Ingentemque fugā secuit sub nubibus arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 658</bibl></cit>.—Of the curving or bendings of a bay: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus curvos falcatus in arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 229</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inque sinus scindit sese unda reductos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 161</bibl></cit>).— <cit><quote lang="la">Of a harbor: Portus ab Euroo fluctu curvatus in arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 533</bibl></cit>.—Of boughs of trees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 26</bibl> et saep.—Of the back of a chair, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3485.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The mathematical arc</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 9</bibl>.—Hence, of the five parallel circles of the globe which bound the zones (or perhaps rather, the zones themselves): <cit><quote lang="la">via quinque per arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ardea: <entryFree id="n3486" type="main" key="arde^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ardĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred with the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)rwdio/s</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">r(wdio/s</foreign>; cf. the Sanscr. rud = sonare</etym>, <sense id="n3486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heron</hi> (in Pliny usu. ardeola, q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 364</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3487" type="main" key="Arde^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ardĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>v. arduus</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arde/a</foreign>, <sense id="n3487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of the Rutuli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">six leagues south of Rome;</hi> acc. to the myth, it was burned by Æneas, and from its ashes the heron (<hi rend="ital">ardea</hi>) was produced, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 573</bibl>; Verg A. 7, 411; cf. Serv. ad h. l.; Mann. Ital. I. 617; Müll. Roms Camp. 2, 296-312.—Hence, Derivv., </sense><sense id="n3487.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ardĕas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (old <case>nom.</case> Ardeātis, like Arpinātis, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 629</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ardea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ardean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agro Ardeati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ardeas templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 115</bibl></cit>.— Hence, in the <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ardeātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Ardea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3487.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ardĕātīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (rare for Ardeas), <hi rend="ital">Ardean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 14, 3</bibl></cit> (Halm, <hi rend="ital">Arretinum</hi>); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, in Ardeatino (sc. agro), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 105" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ardeatis: <entryFree id="n3488" type="main" key="Arde^a_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ardĕātis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Ardea.</entryFree>
ardelio: <entryFree id="n3489" type="main" key="arde^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ardĕlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ardeo</etym>, prop. <sense id="n3489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a zealous person;</hi> hence, in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a busybody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a meddler</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">polupra/gmwn</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 1 sq.</bibl>; cf. the epigrams of <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:79" default="NO">4, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ardens: <entryFree id="n3490" type="main" key="ardens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ardens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from ardeo.</entryFree>
ardenter: <entryFree id="n3491" type="main" key="ardenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ardenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ardeo <sense id="n3491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ardeo: <entryFree id="n3492" type="main" key="arde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ardĕo</orth>, <itype>rsi, rsum, 2</itype>, <sense id="n3492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.n.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> ARDVERINT, Inscr. Fratr. Arval., of the time of the emperor Alexander Severus, in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 961</bibl>) [cf. Sanscr. ghar = to shine. Sonne foll. by Curt.], <hi rend="ital">to take fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kindle;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n3492.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to burn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blaze</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">ardesco, exardeo, flagro, incendor, uror): Nam multis succensa locis ardent sola terrae,</quote> <trans><tr>for the soil is on fire in different places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 592</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta ardentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1064" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1064</bibl></cit>: Ultimus ardebit, quem etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">His home will burn last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom</hi> etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:201" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 201</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardente domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radii ardentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 618</bibl></cit>: circumstant cum ardentibus taedis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl> (Trag. v. 51 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput arsisse Servio Tullio dormienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 53, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis ardens fulminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Praeneste ardentes lapides caelo decidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogum parari Vidit et arsuros supremis ignibus artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 620</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 245</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 747</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arsurae comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbat quod rubus arderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Deut. 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 15, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3492.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3492.3" n="A" level="2"> Of the eyes, <hi rend="ital">to flash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shine</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgeo, inardesco, mico): ardent oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 62</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi ejus (erant) ut lampas ardens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3492.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. to color, <hi rend="ital">to sparkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dazzle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrio ardebat murice laena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi armis sublimibus ardent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 602</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3492.5" n="C" level="2"> In gen., of any passionate emotion<pb n="156" /> <cb n="ARDE" />  or excitement, <hi rend="ital">to burn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be inflamed</hi>, usu. with <case>abl.</case> (dolore, irā, studio, invidiā, etc.), but often without an <hi rend="ital">abl.; to be strongly affected</hi>, esp. with love; <hi rend="ital">to be inflamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blaze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be consumed</hi>, etc. (syn.: ardesco, exardeo, furo). </sense><sense id="n3492.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe patentia cum totiens ardentia morbis Lumina versarent oculorum, expertia somno,</quote> <trans><tr>they rolled around the open eyeballs glowing with heat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">In fluvios partim gelidos ardentia morbo Membra dabant,</quote> <trans><tr>their limbs burning with the heat of fever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardere flagitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1</bibl></cit>. 1, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore et irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studio et amore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">podagrae doloribus,</quote> <trans><tr>to be tormented with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:31:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 31, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum arderet Syria bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n3492.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Without an <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ardere videris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 188</bibl></cit> (incensus <hi rend="ital">esse</hi>, B. and K.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:145" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium animi ad ulciscendum ardebant,</quote> <trans><tr>were fired</tr>, <tr>eager</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ardet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro implacabilis ardet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardet in arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 71</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in caedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object (cf. infra), <hi rend="ital">to desire ardently to do a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruere ardet utroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ardet abire fugā dulcīsque relinquere terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 281</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 895</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:45" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 45</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to burn with love</hi> (syn. uror): <cit><quote lang="la">ex aequo captis ardebant mentibus ambo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus arsit in illā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 50</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laborantes in uno Penelopen vitreamque Circen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 19</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">arsit Virgine raptā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 6</bibl>; and with <case>acc.</case> of the object loved (as supra, in constr. with the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>): formosum pastor Corydon ardebat Alexin, <hi rend="ital">Corydon had a burning passion for</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comptos arsit adulteri Crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphini pueros miris et humanis modis arserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. Arusian. Mess. p. 209 Lind. !*? * <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> arsus, <hi rend="ital">roasted</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 9</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">ardens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, prop. <hi rend="ital">on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">glowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hot</hi>, etc., lit. and trop. </sense><sense id="n3492.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: sol ardentissimus, Tubero ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentissimum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Austri ardentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinta (zona) est ardentior illis,</quote> <trans><tr>hotter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardens Africa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 729</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3492.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3492.10" n="1" level="3"> Of the eyes: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>glowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 451</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3492.11" n="2" level="3"> Of color: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentissimus color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes ardentes auro,</quote> <trans><tr>glowing</tr>, <tr>glittering as with gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 99</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 262</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3492.12" n="3" level="3"> Of wounds, <hi rend="ital">burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smarting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardenti morsu premere dolorem,</quote> <trans><tr>with burning bite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 663</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3492.13" n="4" level="3"> Of wine, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentis Falerni Pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:7:45" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 7, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3492.14" n="5" level="3"> Of passion or strong feeling, <hi rend="ital">burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impatient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia ardens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem ardentiore studio petere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentes in eum litteras ad me misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentissimus dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:42" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:8:2" default="NO">1, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentissimus amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, Reg. 11, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nonne cor nostrum ardens erat in nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:24:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 24, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:30:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 30, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserere ardentis (sc. amore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 691</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardens caedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:662" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 662</bibl></cit>.—In Cic. freq. of passionate, excited discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">nec umquam is qui audiret, incenderetur, nisi ardens ad eum perveniret oratio,</quote> <bibl
