n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:38:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 38, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 27</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">nisi ipse (orator) inflammatus ad eam (mentem) et ardens accesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator gravis, acer, ardens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:99 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 28, 99 al.</bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ardenter</orth>, only trop., <hi rend="ital">in a burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionate manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardenter aliquid cupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 6</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentius sitire,</quote> <trans><tr>to have a more burning thirst</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentius diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 20, 7</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:85:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 85, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentius amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentissime diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ardeola: <entryFree id="n3493" type="main" key="arde^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ardĕŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ardea</etym>, <sense id="n3493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little heron</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 60, 79, § 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:140" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 52, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ardesco: <entryFree id="n3494" type="main" key="ardesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ardesco</orth>, <itype>arsi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n3494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [ardeo], <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> <cb n="ARDU" /> <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be inflamed</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.; while exardesco is very freq.), lit. and trop. </sense><sense id="n3494.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia motu Percalefacta vides ardescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardescunt caelestia templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne longus ardesceret axis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 255</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 12, § 51</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3494.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to gleam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3494.3" n="A" level="2"> Of rays of light: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmineis ardescunt ignibus undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 523</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3494.4" n="B" level="2"> Of the gleaming of a sword: <cit><quote lang="la">pugionem in mucronem ardescere jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3494.5" n="C" level="2"> Most freq. of the passions, <hi rend="ital">to be inflamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become more intense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase in violence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardescere dirā cuppedine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1090" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1090</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:897" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 897</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 41</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 445</bibl>: exarsit in iras, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accensus in iram): in nuptias incestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardescit tuendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 713</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulo ardescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus haec rabies auctoribus arsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 359</bibl></cit>.—So, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fremitus ardescit equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardescente pugnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: in labiis ejus ignis ardescit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 16, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ardifetus: <entryFree id="n3495" type="hapax" key="ardi^fe_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ardĭfētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ardeo-fetus</etym>, <sense id="n3495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pregnant with flame;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of a torch: lampas, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 243, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 312, 6.</sense></entryFree>
ardor: <entryFree id="n3496" type="main" key="ardor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ardor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ardeo</etym>, <sense id="n3496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning heat</hi>, lit. and trop. </sense><sense id="n3496.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exortus est sol cum ardore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jac. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 3, 12: <cit><quote lang="la">flammarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1093" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1093</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1099 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1099 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visas ab occidente faces ardoremque caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor caelestis, qui aether vel caelum nominatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardore deflagrare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardores corporum in morbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 18, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Visitabo vos in egestate et ardore,</quote> <trans><tr>with burning fever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:26:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 26, 16 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n3496.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3496.3" n="A" level="2"> Of the flashing fire of the eyes, <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliancy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervescit et ex oculis micat acribus ardor,</quote> <trans><tr>and fire gleams forth from the keen eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille imperatorius ardor oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 21</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:42:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 42, 107</bibl>.—Of the external appearance in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in te ardor voltuum atque motuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:37:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 37, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <trans><tr>animation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3496.4" n="B" level="2"> Of the passions or feelings, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impatience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardent desire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sive voluptas est sive est contrarius ardor, i. e. dolor,</quote> <trans><tr>some tormenting pain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatum ardore restincto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor mentis ad gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ardorem studii censetis fuisse in Archimede, qui etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor animi non semper adest, isque cum consedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus ardore animi micans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardorem compescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 16</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> from the combatants to the weapons: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus fuit ardor armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ardorem cupiens dissimulare meum,</quote> <trans><tr>glowing love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:12:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 76</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">obj. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at te ejusdem virginis ardor Perdiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:27 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 27 al.</bibl>—And meton., <hi rend="ital">the object of ardent affection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu primus et ultimus illi Ardor eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 683</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arduenna: <entryFree id="n3497" type="main" key="Ardu^enna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ardŭenna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ardenna</orth>, Ven. Fort. Carm. 7, 4), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>v. arduus; cf. Welsh ardh, to raise up</etym>, <sense id="n3497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the forest-covered mountains in Gaul</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ardennes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 29</bibl> Herz.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 42</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gall. p. 203.</sense></entryFree>
arduitas: <entryFree id="n3498" type="hapax" key="ardu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ardŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arduus</etym>, <sense id="n3498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">steepness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium arduitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ardus: <entryFree id="n3499" type="main" key="ardus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ardus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. aridus.</entryFree>
arduus: <entryFree id="n3500" type="main" key="arduus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arduus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>akin to <foreign lang="greek">*a*r*d*w, a)/rsw</foreign> = to water, to cherish; <foreign lang="greek">a)ldai/nw</foreign> = to make grow; <foreign lang="greek">a)ldh/eis</foreign> = growing; alo, altus, q. v.; 1. ad-oleo, ad-olesco; related to arbor, arbutus as <foreign lang="greek">e)ruqro/s</foreign>, Germ. roth, Engl. red, is related to ruber; Ardea was perh. so called from its lofty situation; cf. Arduenna</etym>, <sense id="n3500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi> (syn.: altus, celsus, sublimis). </sense><sense id="n3500.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Pergama ardua, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:730" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et campo sese arduus infert (Turnus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 53</bibl></cit>.—Also in prose in Gell.: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>proudly elevated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confragosus atque arduus clivis,</quote> <trans><tr>steep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arduus ac difficilis ascensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardua et aspera et confragosa via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44</bibl></cit>. 3: via alta atque ardua, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tmolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 150</bibl></cit> al.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">arduum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="AREO" /> <hi rend="ital">steep place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a steep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ardua dum metuunt, amittunt vera viaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ardua montis Ite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 692</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardua terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per arduum scandere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arduis ponet nidum suum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 39, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardua Alpium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingressi sunt ardua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 4, 29</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3500.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3500.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That is difficult to reach</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difficult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laborious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arduous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum opus omnino et arduum conamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum arduarum ac difficilium perpessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id arduum factu erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil mortalibus arduum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fuit in arduo societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3500.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpleasant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primis arduum videtur res gestas scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>, upon which Gellius remarks: Arduum Sallustius non pro difficili tantum, sed pro eo quoque ponit, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">xalepo\n</foreign> appellant: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est cum difficile tum molestum quoque et incommodum et intractabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam arduum onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3500.5" n="C" level="2"> Of fortune, <hi rend="ital">difficult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inauspicious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequam memento rebus in arduis Servare mentem,</quote> <trans><tr>in adversity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.!*? <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> arduior: iter longius arduiusque erat, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 600</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> arduissimus: asperrimo atque arduissimo aditu, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 600</bibl> P.; cf.: assiduus, egregius, industrius, perpetuus, and Rudd. I. p. 180, n. 58.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> not used.</sense></entryFree>
are: <entryFree id="n3501" type="main" key="a_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āre</orth>, v. arefacio.</entryFree>
area: <entryFree id="n3502" type="main" key="a_re^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ārĕa</orth> (in inscriptions freq. ARIA, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4130</bibl>, etc.), ae, <sense id="n3502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [some comp. <foreign lang="greek">e)/raze</foreign> = on the ground; Germ. Erde; Engl. earth, hearth; others, as Varro and Festus, connected it with areo, as if pr. <hi rend="ital">dry land</hi>, as terra may be connected with torreo; so Bopp and Curt.], <hi rend="ital">a piece of level ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vacant place</hi>, esp. in the town (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">planities, aequor): in urbe loca pura areae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 38</bibl></cit> Müll: area proprie dicitur locus vacuus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 11</bibl> Müll.: locus sine aedificio in urbe area; <cit><quote lang="la">rure autem ager appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:211" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 211</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n3502.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">ground</hi> for a house, <hi rend="ital">a building-spot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Ponendae domo quaerenda est area primum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 13</bibl></cit>. arearum electio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontifices si sustulerint religionem, aream praeclaram habebimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:10 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 4, 10 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3502.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3502.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A vacant space around</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in a house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a court</hi> (syn. spatium): <cit><quote lang="la">resedimus in areā domŭs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 27, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 22, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:22:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:1 al" default="NO">8, 2, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3502.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An open space for games</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an open play-ground</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">campus, curriculum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 18</bibl></cit>.— Hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a field for effort</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">campus, locus, q. v.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>, and trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">area scelerum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>where vices have full scope</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 18</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">a raceground</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:10" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 10</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:360" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 360</bibl>); and trop., <hi rend="ital">the course of life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae tribus areis peractis (i. e. pueritiā, juventute, senectute),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:24" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3502.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A threshing floor</hi> (among the ancients, an open space in the vicinity of the house). </sense><sense id="n3502.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque in segetibus neque in areis neque in horreis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:50:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 50, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 21, 10</bibl>. Its construction may be learned from <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 91</bibl> and 129; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 178</bibl> sqq. Voss; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:20" default="NO">5, 2, 20</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 36 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3502.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of the body of Christians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as subject to separation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judgment</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ver. Rel. 5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ver. Rel. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3502.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The halo around the sun</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moon</hi>: tales splendores Graeci areas (i. e. <foreign lang="greek">a(/lwnas</foreign>) vocavere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3502.9" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">border in a garden</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 64</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 20, § 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3502.10" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fowling-floor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 64</bibl>: aedes nobis area est; <cit><quote lang="la">auceps sum ego,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3502.11" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A burying-ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">church-yard</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Scap. 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n3502.12" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bald spot upon the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baldness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:50" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arealis: <entryFree id="n3503" type="hapax" key="a_re^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ārĕālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>area</etym>, <sense id="n3503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a threshing-floor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cribrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 166</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
areatae: <entryFree id="n3504" type="main" key="Are^a_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arĕātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Sarmatian tribe</hi>, also called Arraei, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arectaeus: <entryFree id="n3505" type="main" key="A^rectaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărectaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from <foreign />, acc. to O. T. Gen. 10, 10, an Assyrio-Babylonian<pb n="157" /> <cb n="AREO" />  town; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 21</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n3505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Babylonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:142" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 142</bibl></cit> (al. Areccei).</sense></entryFree>
arefacio: <entryFree id="n3506" type="main" key="a_re^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ārĕ-făcĭo</orth> (contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">arfăcĭo</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 69</bibl>; <sense id="n3506.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">per anastrophen, facio are,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:962" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 962</bibl></cit>; cf. Rudd. II. p. 392), <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>areo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi> (anteclass. and post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: sicco, exsicco, coquo, uro),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 69</bibl></cit>: principio terram sol excoquit et facit are, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:962" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 962</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 38</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 15, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jac. 1, 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arefieri in furno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 26, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulis arefactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 22, 43, § 125</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 13, 35, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27</bibl>, n. 7; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arefacta est terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficulnea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 21, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3506.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">to wither up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentem superbam arefecit Deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arefacient animam suam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 14, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arelas: <entryFree id="n3507" type="main" key="A^re^las"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕlas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕlātē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Clar. Urb. 8</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)are/latai</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*)are/laton</foreign>, <sense id="n3507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Southern Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the eastern branch of the Rhone</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Arles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 36</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gall. 96.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕlātensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Arelatian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 57, § 116</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕlāten-ses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Arelas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2:34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 2, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aremoricae: <entryFree id="n3508" type="main" key="A^re_mo^ri^cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărēmŏrĭcae</orth>, v. Armoricae.</entryFree>
arena: <entryFree id="n3509" type="main" key="a^re_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. harena.</entryFree>
arenaceus: <entryFree id="n3510" type="main" key="a^re_na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărēnācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. harenaceus.</entryFree>
arenacum: <entryFree id="n3511" type="main" key="A^re^na_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕnācum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕnātium</orth>, Tab. Peut.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hărĕnātium</orth>, Itin. Anton.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Belgica, now <hi rend="ital">Ærth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Arth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Herwen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:20 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 20 sq.</bibl>; cf. Ukert, Gall. p. 531.</sense></entryFree>
arenarius: <entryFree id="n3512" type="main" key="a^re_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. harenarius.</entryFree>
arenatio: <entryFree id="n3513" type="main" key="a^re_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărēnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. harenatio.</entryFree>
arenatus: <entryFree id="n3514" type="main" key="a^re_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărēnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. harenatus.</entryFree>
arenifodina: <entryFree id="n3515" type="main" key="a^re_ni^fo^di_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărēnĭ-fŏdīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. hareni-fodina.</entryFree>
arenivagus: <entryFree id="n3516" type="main" key="a^re_ni^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărēnĭ-văgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. harenivagus.</entryFree>
arenosus: <entryFree id="n3517" type="main" key="a^re_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărēnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. harenosus.</entryFree>
arens: <entryFree id="n3518" type="main" key="a_rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ārens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from areo.</entryFree>
arenula: <entryFree id="n3519" type="main" key="a^re_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărēnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. harenula.</entryFree>
areo: <entryFree id="n3520" type="main" key="a_re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ārĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>akin to ardere</etym>, <sense id="n3520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be dry</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n3520.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi (amurca) arebit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti, quom exivissem ex aquā, arerem tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(tellus) sucis aret ademtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 211</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:268" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 268</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3520.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> of things, <hi rend="ital">to be dried up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">withered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arentibus siti faucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 38</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces arent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aret ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars, super quam non plui, aruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Amos, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: omnia ligna agri aruerunt, ib. Joel, 1, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 11, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 14, 15</bibl>.—Rarely of persons, <hi rend="ital">to languish from thirst</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediā Tantalus aret aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 606</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Sic aret mediis taciti vulgator in undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 51</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ārens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n3520.3" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arens alveus (fluminis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 268</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 350</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: cetera (loca) abrupta aut arentia, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 42</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n3520.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">languishing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fainting from thirst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirsty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidisque arentia venis Ora patent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 556</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 277</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> as an epithet of thirst itself: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 5</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis arida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1175</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 129</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
areola: <entryFree id="n3521" type="main" key="a_re^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ārĕŏla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">āri-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>area</etym>. <sense id="n3521.0" n="I" level="1"> (After area, I.) <hi rend="ital">A small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cenatio areolam aspicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ARIOLA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 584, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3521.1" n="II" level="1"> (After area, II. E.) <hi rend="ital">A small garden-bed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garden</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">cultivated place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:362" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 362</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:30" default="NO">11, 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">areolae aromatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 17, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
areopagites: <entryFree id="n3522" type="greek" key="A^re_o^pa^gi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărēŏpăgītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)areiopagi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n3522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Areopagite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a member of the court of the Areopagus at Athens</hi> (v. Areopagus), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 19</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 190 Vahl.); Varr. L. L. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 25, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 1</bibl>.—Hence, † <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărēŏpăgītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)areiopagitiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to an Areopagite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gymnasia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
areopagus: <entryFree id="n3523" type="greek" key="A^re_o^pa^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărēŏpăgus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/areios pa/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n3523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Mars' Hill at Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which the Areopagus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the highest judicial assembly of</hi> <cb n="AREU" /> <hi rend="ital">the Athenians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">held its sessions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Areopagitae ab Areopago: is locus est Athenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 19</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 25, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 19</bibl> sqq. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14</bibl> used as a Greek word; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 55</bibl>, called Areum judicium; and in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:101" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 101</bibl>, Curia Martis; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 70</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
arepennis: <entryFree id="n3524" type="foreign" key="arepennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arepennis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gallic; in mod. Fr. arpent = an acre</etym>; <sense id="n3524.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">syn. with semijugerum,</quote> <trans><tr>a half acre of ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arapennis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 15, p. 485</bibl></cit> Lind.</sense></entryFree>
ares: <entryFree id="n3525" type="main" key="A^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/arhs</foreign>, <sense id="n3525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the war-god Mars</hi> (in Plaut. jocosely made to correspond with bellator, warrior): <cit><quote lang="la">si tu ad legionem bellator clues, at ego in culinā Ares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 54</bibl></cit>. (For the <hi rend="ital">A</hi>, which is always short in Lat., cf. Lucil. ap. Scaur. Orth. p. 2255 P., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 12</bibl>, with reference to Hom. Il. 5, 31.)</sense></entryFree>
aresco: <entryFree id="n3526" type="main" key="a_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n3526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi> [areo], <hi rend="ital">to become dry.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3526.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum mea (vestimenta) arescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius arescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arescat aqua de mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arescente undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi faenum, ita arescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:51:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 51, 12</bibl></cit>.—Of tears: <cit><quote lang="la">cito arescit lacrima, praesertim in alienis malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3526.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to languish.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3526.3" n="A" level="2"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wither</hi>: nullo modo facilius arbitror posse herbas arescere et interfici, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi>, Cic. Oecon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 450, 1</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 57, § 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncus (arboris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 17, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">17, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 15, 6</bibl></cit>: manus (branch), ib. Job, 15, 32.—</sense><sense id="n3526.4" n="B" level="2"> Of persons (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">to pine away in sickness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(filius meus) stridet dentibus et arescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 9, 17</bibl></cit>.—So, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be overcome</hi>, with fear: <cit><quote lang="la">arescentibus hominibus prae timore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 21, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arestorides: <entryFree id="n3527" type="main" key="A^resto^ri^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărestŏrĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n3527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">patr.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arestori/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">son of Arestor</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Argus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 624</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aretalogus: <entryFree id="n3528" type="greek" key="a^re^ta_lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărĕtālŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)retalo/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n3528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prattler about virtue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a babbler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boaster;</hi> in gen. of a Cynic or Stoic, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl> Casaub.: <cit><quote lang="la">mendax aretalogus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. ethologus.</sense></entryFree>
arete: <entryFree id="n3529" type="main" key="A_re_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ārētē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arh/th</foreign>, <sense id="n3529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Alcinous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of the Phœacians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 23" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arethon: <entryFree id="n3530" type="main" key="A^re^thon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕthon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕtho</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)are/qwn</foreign>, <sense id="n3530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 3</bibl> and 4.</sense></entryFree>
arethusa: <entryFree id="n3531" type="main" key="A^re^thu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕthūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)are/qousa</foreign>. <sense id="n3531.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated fountain near Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to the fable, a nymph in the train of Diana, in Elis, pursued by the river-god Alpheus, fled to Sicily,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 573</bibl></cit> (cf. Pausan. 5, 7); <cit><quote lang="la">hence it was believed that it flowed under the sea with the Alpheus, and appeared again in Sicily,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 4</bibl></cit> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 694</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:55" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 5, 30, § 55</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. II. 325, and Alpheus.—</sense><sense id="n3531.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fountain in Eubœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3531.2" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fountain in Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3531.3" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A lake in Armenia Major</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 226</bibl> (Jan, <hi rend="ital">Aritissa</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n3531.4" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3531.5" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Syria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Orontes</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Rustan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Restun</hi>, Itin. Anton. —</sense><sense id="n3531.6" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n3531.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕthūsaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the fountain Arethusa</hi> (in Sicily), <hi rend="ital">Arethusian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3531.8" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕthūsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Arethusian</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet for Syracuse, near which was the fountain Arethusa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:873" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 873</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7</bibl>: Aganippis Hippocrene).—</sense><sense id="n3531.9" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕthūsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n3531.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Arethusian;</hi> hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Syracusan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:356" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 356</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3531.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĕthūsĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n3531.12" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The inhabitants of Arethusa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3531.13" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The inhabitants of Arethusa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 23, 19, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aretinus: <entryFree id="n3532" type="main" key="A_re_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ārētīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ārr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n3532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the town Aretium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:54" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. Müll. Etrusk. 2, 244.—</sense><sense id="n3532.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ārētīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Aretium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aretium: <entryFree id="n3533" type="main" key="A_re_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ārētĭum</orth> (ARRETIVM, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3547 al.</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large town in Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Arezzo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 160</bibl>; cf. Müll. Etrusk. 1, 125; 1, 128; 1, 224; 1, 233 al.; Mann. Ital. I. 402.</sense></entryFree>
areus: <entryFree id="n3534" type="main" key="A^re_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/areios</foreign>, <sense id="n3534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining<cb n="ARGE" />  to Mars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>the Areopagus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 55</bibl></cit>; v. Areopagus.</sense></entryFree>
arferia: <entryFree id="n3535" type="gloss" key="arferia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arferia</orth> <itype>aqua, quae inferis libabatur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 11</bibl> Müll. [ar, = ad, and fero].</entryFree>
arganthonius: <entryFree id="n3536" type="main" key="Argantho_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arganthōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arganqw/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n3536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Tartessian king who lived to a great age</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 13</bibl>, ext. 4 (cf. Herod. 1, 163); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 17</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arganthōnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Arganthonius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:396" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 396</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arganthus: <entryFree id="n3537" type="main" key="Arganthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arganthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Mysia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Bithynia</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*)arganqw/nion o)/ros</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arganthi Pegae sub vertice montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
argei: <entryFree id="n3538" type="main" key="Arge_i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argēi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n3538.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A part of the city of Rome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argeorum sacraria in septem et XX. partes urbis sunt disposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=45 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 45 sq.</bibl></cit>: Argea loca Romae appellantur, quod in his sepulti essent quidam Argivorum illustres viri, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=19" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 19</bibl> Müll. (v. Müll. ad h. l.): <cit><quote lang="la">multa alia sacrificia locaque sacris faciendis, quae Argeos pontifices vocant, (Numa) dedicavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:791" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 791</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3538.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Figures of men</hi> (<hi rend="ital">twentythree in number</hi>) <hi rend="ital">made of rushes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which were annually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Ides of May</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrown into the Tiber from the</hi> Pons Sublicius. Acc. to the belief of the ancients, it was necessary that these figures should take the place of the earlier human sacrifices, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 44</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:621 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 621 sq.</bibl>: Argeos vocabant scirpeas effigies, quae per virgines Vestales annis singulis jaciebantur in Tiberim, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 15</bibl> Müll.; cf. Fest. s. v. sexagenarios, p. 334 ib.; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 43</bibl> ib. (Ann. v. 124 ib.).</sense></entryFree>
argema: <entryFree id="n3539" type="greek" key="arge^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argĕma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/rgema</foreign> [<foreign lang="greek">a)rgh/eis</foreign>, white; cf. <sense id="n3539.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">albugo],</quote> <trans><tr>a small ulcer in the eye</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 20, § 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:144" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 92, § 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argemon: <entryFree id="n3540" type="greek" key="arge^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argĕmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/rgemon</foreign>, <sense id="n3540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb;</hi> in pure Lat., lappa canaria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 116, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argemone: <entryFree id="n3541" type="greek" key="arge^mo_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argĕmōnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rgemw/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n3541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb;</hi> in pure Lat., inguinalis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 9, 59, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argemonia: <entryFree id="n3542" type="main" key="arge^mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argĕmōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi> similar to the preceding, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 56, § 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argennon: <entryFree id="n3543" type="gloss" key="argennon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argennon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)rgenno/s</foreign>, white</etym>, <sense id="n3543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">white silver</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 14</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
argentanum: <entryFree id="n3544" type="main" key="Argenta_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argentānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Bruttii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argentaria: <entryFree id="n3545" type="main" key="argenta_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argentārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. argentarius, II. B.</entryFree>
argentarium: <entryFree id="n3546" type="main" key="argenta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argentārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. argentarius, II. C.</entryFree>
argentarius: <entryFree id="n3547" type="main" key="argenta_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>argentum</etym>. <sense id="n3547.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to silver</hi> (cf. argentum, I. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">metalla,</quote> <trans><tr>silver-mines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 26, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbum,</quote> <trans><tr>a mixture of tin and lead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 95</bibl></cit>, and 34, 17, 48, § <cit><quote lang="la">160: creta,</quote> <trans><tr>for polishing silver</tr>, <tr>tripoli</tr>, <tr>rottenstone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 17, 58, § 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faber,</quote> <trans><tr>a worker in silver</tr>, <tr>silver-smith</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3547.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to money</hi> (cf. argentum, I. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">amore pereo et inopiā argentariā,</quote> <trans><tr>am dying of love and want of money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <trans><tr>possessions in money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium,</quote> <trans><tr>pecuniary assistance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt meretrices omnes elecebrae argentariae,</quote> <trans><tr>enticers away of money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <trans><tr>care of money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taberna,</quote> <trans><tr>a banker's stall</tr>, <tr>bank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <trans><tr>a banking-table</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:4 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 13, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> in all genders, like aerarius, harenarius, etc. (only thus in Cic., never as an <pos>adj.</pos>). </sense><sense id="n3547.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">argentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n3547.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A money-changer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banker</hi> (by whom much business was transacted, since all business transactions were committed to writing by them; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 13, 10</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 103</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 29 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentarii tabulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3547.4" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. faber.) <hi rend="ital">A silver-smith</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Sap. 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:40:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 40, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demetrius, argentarius faciens aedes argenteas Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 19, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 913</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">995</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4146</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3547.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">argentārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. taberna). </sense><sense id="n3547.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A banking-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bank</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 47</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3547.7" n="2" level="3"> (sc. ars.) <hi rend="ital">The vocation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">employment of a bank</hi> <pb n="158" /> <cb n="ARGE" /> <hi rend="ital">er</hi> or <hi rend="ital">broker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Fulcinius, qui Romae argentariam non ignobilem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentariā dissolutā,</quote> <trans><tr>after the dissolution</tr>, <tr>closing up</tr>, <tr>of the bank</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">administrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3547.8" n="3" level="3"> (Sc. fodina; cf.: aeraria, harenaria, ferraria, etc.) <hi rend="ital">A silver-mine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 19</bibl> (conj. of Weissenb.).—* </sense><sense id="n3547.9" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">argentārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place for keeping silver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cupboard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safe for plate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3548" type="main" key="Argenta_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argentārĭus</orth> mons. <sense id="n3548.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory on the coast of Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Argentaro</hi>, Rutil. Itin. I. pp. 315-324.—</sense><sense id="n3548.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The part of Mons Orospeda</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which the Bœtis took its rise</hi>, so called from its silvermines, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Or. Marit. 291</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argentatus: <entryFree id="n3549" type="main" key="argenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>argentum</etym> (cf. aeratus and auratus, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 828</bibl> P.). <sense id="n3549.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ornamented with silver</hi> (cf. argentum, I. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">sandalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:2:65" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: milites, <hi rend="ital">whose shields were covered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plated with silver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3549.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Furnished with money</hi> (cf. argentum, I. B. 2.): semper tu ad me cum argentatā accedito querimoniā, <hi rend="ital">come always with silvered complaints</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">bring money with your complaints</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argenteolus: <entryFree id="n3550" type="main" key="argente^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argentĕŏlus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">argentĭŏlus</orth>, Fronto de Or. 1), a, um, <sense id="n3550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [argenteus], <hi rend="ital">of silver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicilicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
argenteus: <entryFree id="n3551" type="main" key="argente^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argentĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>argentum</etym>. <sense id="n3551.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from silver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of silver</hi> (cf. argentum, I. A.): polubrum, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 544, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brattea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 31, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phalerae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 73</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:24:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 24, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Tim. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Triton,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Par. 28, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 47</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">denarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> argenteus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:20:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 20, 16</bibl>;
