<bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 26, 15 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3551.1" n="II" level="1"> Metaph. </sense><sense id="n3551.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adorned with silver</hi>, = argentatus: <cit><quote lang="la">scaena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 39</bibl></cit> (cf. a little before: per picta atque aurata scuta; and v. argentatus, I.).— </sense><sense id="n3551.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of a white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silver color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silvery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">niveis argentea pennis Ales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:213" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 213</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:407" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:4:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:90 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 90 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3551.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of the silver age</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subiit argentea proles, Auro deterior, fulvo pretiosior aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3551.5" n="III" level="1"> In comic style, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from money</hi> (cf. argentum, I. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">salus,</quote> <trans><tr>a silver salutation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:44 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 44 sq.</bibl></cit>: amica tua facta est argentea, <hi rend="ital">is turned into money</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">has been sold</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3552" type="main" key="Argente^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argentĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n3552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing epithet of a river in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, now <hi rend="ital">Argents</hi>: flumen Argenteum, Lepidus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 34, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis Argenteus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 35</bibl></cit>; with a <hi rend="ital">tēte du pont</hi> and castle: Pons Argenteus, Lepidus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 34</bibl>, B.</sense></entryFree>
argentia: <entryFree id="n3553" type="main" key="Argenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in upper Italy</hi>, between Milan and Bergamo, Itin. Hieros.</sense></entryFree>
argentiexterebronides: <entryFree id="n3554" type="hapax" key="Argentiexte^re^bro^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argentiextĕrĕbrŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a word formed by Plautus in jest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the name of one who is skilled in extorting money</hi> [argentum-exterebro], <hi rend="ital">a sponger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 21</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 35</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
argentifodina: <entryFree id="n3555" type="main" key="argenti_fo^di_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argentī-fŏdīna</orth> (also written separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">argentī fŏdīna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>argentum</etym>, <sense id="n3555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a silver - mine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Odor ex argenti fodinis inimicus omnibus animalibus, sed maxume canibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 31, § 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argentinus: <entryFree id="n3556" type="main" key="Argenti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argentīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of silver money</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 21; cf. Aesculanus.</sense></entryFree>
argentoratus: <entryFree id="n3557" type="main" key="Argento^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argentŏrātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a city</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Strasburg in Alsace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gall. 270.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Argen-tŏrātensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Argentoratus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 42" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Ep. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
argentosus: <entryFree id="n3558" type="hapax" key="argento_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argentōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>argentum</etym>, <sense id="n3558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in silver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 29, § 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
argentum: <entryFree id="n3559" type="main" key="argentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)rgh/eis, a)rgh/s</foreign>, Dor. <foreign lang="greek">a)rga=s</foreign>, white, like Tarentum, from <foreign lang="greek">*ta/ras</foreign>, <cb n="ARGI" /> Doed. Syn. III. p. 193; prop. <hi rend="ital">white</hi> metal; cf. Sanscr. arǵunas = bright; raǵatam = silver; hence</etym>, <sense id="n3559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">silver</hi>, whose mineralogical description is found in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 31, § 95</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n3559.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti metalla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 33, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti aerisque metalla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:35:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 35, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti vena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 31, § 95</bibl></cit>: argenti fodina, v. argenti-fodina; <cit><quote lang="la">argenti scoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 5, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spuma argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti duae differentiae (sunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 10, 44, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum candidum, rufum, nigrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum infectum,</quote> <trans><tr>unwrought silver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: argentum purum, Foedus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argento circumcludere cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Concisum argentum in titulos faciesque minutas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:291" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod usquam est Auri atque argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum et aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:24:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 24, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum argentumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2</bibl></cit>. 82: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum et argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3559.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3559.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Wrought silver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">things made of silver; silver-plate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silver-work</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu argentum eluito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec domus argento fulget auroque renidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ridet argento domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti quod erat solis fulgebat in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:109" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentumque expositum in aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis plena argenti facti atque signati,</quote> <trans><tr>full of wrought and stamped silver</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 25</bibl> and 26: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum caelatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 23, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apponitur cena in argento puro et antiquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum et marmor vetus aeraque et artīs Suspice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 76</bibl>; 2, 2, 181; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti vascula puri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:19" default="NO">10, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa omnia ex argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 7, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 17, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leve argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum paternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:355" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Empturus pueros, argentum, murrina, villas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 133</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n3559.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Silver as weighed out for money</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">money coined from silver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silver money;</hi> and, as the most current coin, for <hi rend="ital">money</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">appendit pecuniam, quadringentos siclos argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 23, 16</bibl></cit>: Ratio quidem hercle adparet; argentum <foreign lang="greek">oi)/xetai</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 15 sq.</bibl> (quoted by Cic., Pis. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">expetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adnumerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 20 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti sitis famesque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis audet Argento praeferre caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenue argentum venaeque secundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic modium argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:220" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter Argenti gravis capax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argentum et aurum non est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">20, 35</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n3559.5" n="II" level="1"> Argentum vivum, <hi rend="ital">quicksilver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 32, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl> sqq.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">argentum liquidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 19, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
argestes: <entryFree id="n3560" type="greek" key="argestes1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argestes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rge/sths</foreign>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl>, <sense id="n3560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the west-southwest wind;</hi> acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 120</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">the west-northwest wind.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3561" type="main" key="Argestes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argestes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arge/sths</foreign>, <sense id="n3561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Astrœus and Aurora</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argeus: <entryFree id="n3562" type="main" key="Arge_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Argos, II. B.</entryFree>
argi: <entryFree id="n3563" type="main" key="Argi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Argos <sense id="n3563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
argia: <entryFree id="n3564" type="main" key="Argi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)argei/a</foreign>. <sense id="n3564.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Adrastus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Polynices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:266" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 266</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3564.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Wife of Inachus and mother of Io</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab 145" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argiletum: <entryFree id="n3565" type="main" key="Argi_le_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argīlētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Argiletum sunt qui scripserunt ab Argolā, seu quod is huc venerit ibique sit sepultus; <cit><quote lang="la">alii ab argillā, quod ibi id genus terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=157" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 157</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sane Argiletum quasi Argilletum multi volunt a pingui terrā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 345</bibl></cit>; cf. Spald. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 31</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n3565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the</hi> Vicus Tuscus, <hi rend="ital">between the</hi> Circus Maximus <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Mons Aventinus, <hi rend="ital">where handicraftsmen and booksellers traded</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 345</bibl>.—Also, acc. to the first explanation of the word, separated (per tmesin): <cit><quote lang="la">Argique letum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:17:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:118:9" default="NO">1, 118, 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Argīlētānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the place Argiletum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificium,</quote> <trans><tr>standing upon the Argiletum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1</bibl>. 20, 1).</sense></entryFree>
argilla: <entryFree id="n3566" type="greek" key="argilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/rgillos</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">a)rgh/s</foreign>, white), <sense id="n3566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">white clay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potter's earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">argil;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 34, 3</bibl>: homulus ex argillā<cb n="ARGO" />  et luto fictus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25</bibl>: glandes ferventes ex argillā fusili, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 53</bibl> (<foreign lang="greek">e)c a)rgi/llhs tethgme/nhs</foreign>, Paraphr.): idoneus arti Cuilibet, argillā quidvis imitabitur udā, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 8</bibl>: Tenuis ubi argilla et dumosis calculus arvis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argillaceus: <entryFree id="n3567" type="hapax" key="argilla_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argillācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>argilla</etym>, <sense id="n3567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clayey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of clay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">argillaceous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 7, 4, § 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
argillosus: <entryFree id="n3568" type="main" key="argillo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argillōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of clay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in clay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 31</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arginusae: <entryFree id="n3569" type="main" key="Arginu_sae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arginūsae</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arginussae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arginou=sai</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*)arginou=ssai</foreign>, <sense id="n3569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three small islands in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Lesbos</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem ab Arginusis removere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 84</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">Arginussae ab Aege IIII. M. passuum distant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 39, § 140</bibl></cit> Jan.—And in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa Arginussam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 58, 83, § 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
argiphontes: <entryFree id="n3570" type="main" key="Argi_phontes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argīphontes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)argeifo/nths</foreign> (Hom. Il. 2, 103), <sense id="n3570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Argus-slayer</hi>, an epithet of Mercury, who slew the hundredeyed Argus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 209</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S, 1, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argithea: <entryFree id="n3571" type="main" key="Argi^the^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argĭthĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Athamania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Knisovo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argitis: <entryFree id="n3572" type="main" key="argi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)rgh/s</foreign> = white</etym>, <sense id="n3572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vine with white clusters of grapes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 21</bibl> and 27; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 5, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argivus: <entryFree id="n3573" type="main" key="Argi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argīvus</orth>, v. Argos, II. A.</entryFree>
argo: <entryFree id="n3574" type="main" key="Argo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argo</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n3574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Argūs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:22:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 22, 19</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Argo, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 94</bibl> P.; Argon, Prop 1, 20, 17 Müll.; <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case> prob. not used), = <foreign lang="greek">*)argw/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the name of the ship in which the Greek heroes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under the guidance of Jason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sailed to Colchis in quest of the golden fleece</hi>, Enn. ap. Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 2, 22</bibl> (Trag. v. 284 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4</bibl>. 34 al. Later placed by Minerva as a constellation in heaven (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 126</bibl>; also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 114</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:66" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decimo Cal. Octobr. Argo navis occidit: tempestatem significat, interdum pluviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—Acc. to the first signif., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Argō-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)argw=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Argo</hi>, and in gen. <hi rend="ital">to the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:22:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 22, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:57" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:436" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 436</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:116" default="NO">6, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:573" default="NO">7, 573</bibl>; 8, 294.</sense></entryFree>
argolicus: <entryFree id="n3575" type="main" key="Argo^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argŏlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Argos, II. C. 2.</entryFree>
argolis: <entryFree id="n3576" type="main" key="Argo^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argŏlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Argos, II. C. 1.</entryFree>
argonautae: <entryFree id="n3577" type="main" key="Argo^nautae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argŏnautae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)argonau=tai</foreign> (the sailors of the Argo), <sense id="n3577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:353" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 353</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 23, § 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehiculum Argonautarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Jason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:69 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 69 al.</bibl></cit>— Martial, in his Epigr. 3, 67, De pigris nautis, plays upon the word, deriving it from <foreign lang="greek">a)rgo/s</foreign>, lazy, instead of <foreign lang="greek">*)argw/</foreign>, making Argonautae = pigri nautae.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Argŏ-nautĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">relating to the Argonauts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Argonautic.</hi>—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Argŏnautĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a poem by</hi> Valerius Flaccus, <hi rend="ital">which has for its subject the Argonautic expedition;</hi> cf. Bähr, <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. p. 100; Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 312.</sense></entryFree>
argos: <entryFree id="n3578" type="main" key="Argo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argŏs</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> (only <case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case>), more freq. in the <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Argi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 89</bibl> Müll.: Graecanice hoc Argos, cum Latine Argei; cf. Prob. p. 1447 P.; Phocae Ars, p. 1707 P.), = <foreign lang="greek">*)/argos</foreign>. <sense id="n3578.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Argos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the capital of Argolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Peloponnesus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred to Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Argos Hippium and Argos Dipsium or Inachium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:56:57" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 56, 57</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Mann. Gr. p. 641 sq.: quaerit Argos Amymonen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 240</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:414" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 414</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">securum per Argos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriis ab Argis Pellor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 476</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 286</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 25</bibl> et saep.—The <case>acc.</case> Argos, occurring in the histt., is best considered as <number>plur.</number>, since the <number>sing.</number> seems rather to belong to the poets and geographers (e. g. Plin. above cited); cf. Daehne and Bremi ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3578.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, Argos is sometimes put for <hi rend="ital">the whole of Greece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 60</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3578.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv., the <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n3578.3" n="A. 1." level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Argīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (i. e. ArgiFus from ArgeiFos, like Achivus from <foreign lang="greek">*)axaio/s</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">of Argos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Argive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argivus orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augur,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Amphiaraus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 12</bibl></cit> <pb n="159" /> <cb n="ARGU" /> —<hi rend="ital">An epithet of Juno</hi> (as in the Iliad <foreign lang="greek">*)argei/a</foreign> is an appel. of Here) <hi rend="ital">as tutelary goddess of Argos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 547</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3578.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Greek</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phalanx,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 393</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 25</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 38</bibl>: Graja Camena).—And so Argivi for <hi rend="ital">the Greeks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis Argivūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 672</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1</bibl>, ext. 4.— </sense><sense id="n3578.5" n="B" level="2"> Without digamma, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Argēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Argī-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Argive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argia sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 113</bibl></cit> (B. and K., <hi rend="ital">Argiva</hi>): Tibur Argeo positum colono (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 670</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 5</bibl> K. and H.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Tibur Argeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 46</bibl></cit> Merk. —</sense><sense id="n3578.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Argŏlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)argoli/s</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n3578.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Argive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alcmene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 735</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3578.8" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> (sc. terra), <hi rend="ital">the province of Argolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Peloponnesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4</bibl> prooem.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Argŏlĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)argoliko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Argolic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <trans><tr>the Nemean lion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1932 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1932 al.</bibl></cit>—Also <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <trans><tr>the Grecian leaders in the Trojan war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:659" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 659</bibl></cit> al.—* </sense><sense id="n3578.9" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Argus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Argive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argus pro Argivus, Plaut. Am. (prol. 98): Amphitruo natus Argis ex Argo patre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 487, 31</bibl></cit>. (So the much-contested passage seems to be better explained than when, with Gronov. Observv. 4, 298, Argo is considered as <case>abl.</case> from Argos, <hi rend="ital">begotten of a father from Argos</hi>, to which Argis in the <number>plur.</number> does not correspond.)</sense></entryFree>
argous: <entryFree id="n3579" type="main" key="Argo_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Argo <sense id="n3579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
argumentabilis: <entryFree id="n3580" type="main" key="argu_menta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūmentābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>argumentum</etym>, <sense id="n3580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be proved</hi>: propositio difficile argumentabilis, Boëth. Arist. Anal. 1, 27.</sense></entryFree>
argumentalis: <entryFree id="n3581" type="hapax" key="argu_menta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūmentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing proof</hi>: narratio, Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">argūmentālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by way of proof</hi>, Aggen. Urb. Com. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=64" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 64</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
argumentatio: <entryFree id="n3582" type="main" key="argu_menta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūmentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>argumentor</etym> (a rhet. t. t., most freq. in Cic.). <sense id="n3582.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An adducing of proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an argumentation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentatio nomine uno res duas significat, ideo, quod et inventum aliquam in rem probabile aut necessarium, argumentatio vocatur et ejus inventi artificiosa expolitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentatio est explicatio argumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicuitas argumentatione elevatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositio verbosior quibusdam argumentis, argumentis dico, non argumentatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:35" default="NO">5, 14, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:164 al" default="NO">11, 3, 164 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3582.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The proof itself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamne in tam perspicuis rebus argumentatio quaerenda est aut conjectura capienda?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
argumentator: <entryFree id="n3583" type="main" key="argu_menta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūmentātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that adduces proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an arguer;</hi> only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argumentatrix: <entryFree id="n3584" type="hapax" key="argu_menta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūmentātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>argumentator</etym>, <sense id="n3584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that adduces proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a female arguer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argumentor: <entryFree id="n3585" type="main" key="argu_mentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūmentor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>argumentum</etym>. <sense id="n3585.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To adduce proof of a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego neque in causis, si quid est evidens, de quo inter omnes conveniat, argumentari soleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum essem argumentatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:277" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 80, 277</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —</sense><sense id="n3585.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To adduce something as proof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ego illa non argumentabor, quae sunt gravia vehementer, eum corrupisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3585.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make a conclusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to conclude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de voluntate alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 35</bibl>.!*? <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: omnia argumentata nomina <foreign lang="greek">pistwqe/nta</foreign>, Aufusius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
argumentosus: <entryFree id="n3586" type="main" key="argu_mento_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūmentōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n3586.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rich in proof</hi> (v. argumentum, I. A.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 9</bibl>; Acron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3586.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rich in matter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">material</hi> (v. argumentum, II. A. a.): <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
argumentum: <entryFree id="n3587" type="main" key="argu_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>arguo</etym>. <sense id="n3587.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The means by which an assertion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assumption may be made clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an argument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proof</hi> (and in particular, that which rests upon facts, while ratio is that which depends upon reasoning): <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum est ratio, quae rei dubiae facit fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: quid est argumentum?<cb n="ARGU" />  Probabile inventum ad faciendam fidem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum est ratio probationem praestans, quā colligitur aliquid per aliud, et quae, quod est dubium, per id quod dubium non est, confirmat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eā re signa atque argumenta paucis verbis eloquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 267</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 26 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commemorando Argumenta fidem dictis conradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 401</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 417</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta multa et firma ad probandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:272" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 78, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid exemplis magis quam argumentis refellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumento esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae ad senatum missae argumentum fuere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">In argumentum fidei retentum pallium ostendit marito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:39:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 39, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopia fecerat eam (rem parvam) argumentum ingens caritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Est fides argumentum non apparentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addit pro argumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut argumentum rursus conditae urbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levibus utrimque argumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n3587.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sign by which any thing is known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evidence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi laeti Argumenta,</quote> <trans><tr>signs</tr>, <tr>indications</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti potentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:745" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 745</bibl></cit>: unguentarii myrrham digerunt haud difficulter odoris atque pinguetudinis argumentis, <hi rend="ital">according to the indications of smell</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 15, 35, § 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum quidem haud dubie caelati argumenti dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris hoc est argumentum, non malignitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 137, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta viri, i. e. indicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:85 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 85 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3587.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The matter which lies at the basis of any written</hi> or <hi rend="ital">artistic representation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">argument</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">u(po/qesis</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argumentum plura significat. Nam et fabulae ad actum scaenicarum compositae argumenta dicuntur: et orationum Ciceronis velut thema ipse exponens Pedianus, argumentum, inquit, tale est: quo apparet omnem ad scribendum destinatam materiam ita appellari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 9</bibl></cit> and 10. </sense><sense id="n3587.3" n="A" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">every kind of representation in writing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3587.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum est ficta res, quae tamen fieri potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae novae, quid habent argumenti, nisi ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>what is their drift? what do they mean?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 19</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n3587.5" n="a" level="4"> But esp. freq., <hi rend="ital">the subject-matter of a poem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fictitious writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contents</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post argumentum hujus eloquar tragoediae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 96</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum narrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. prol. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Livius Andronicus ab saturis ausus est primus argumento fabulam serere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a scenic representation of a subject in its connection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum, quo argumenta inferorum explicarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 57</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3587.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (<hi rend="ital">part for the whole</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a poem</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">explicare argumenti exitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc argumento se describi sentiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 3</bibl>; cf. Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumque argumenti conditor ipse mei,</quote> <trans><tr>I am myself the subject of my poem</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:10" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3587.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">intrinsic worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tota fabella ... quam est sine argumento,</quote> <trans><tr>without value</tr>, <tr>reality</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine argumento maledicere,</quote> <trans><tr>not without some reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n3587.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The subject of artistic representations</hi> (<hi rend="ital">sculpture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">painting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embroidery.</hi> etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex ebore diligentissime perfecta argumenta erant in valvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cratera) fabricaverat Alcon Hyleus, et longo caelaverat argumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 684</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus in telā deducitur argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 791</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parrhasii tabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 44</bibl></cit>.— In philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">a conclusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a syllogism</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nam concludi non potest nisi iis, quae ad concludendum sumpta erunt, ita probatis ut falsa ejusdem modi nulla possint esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 44 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
arguo: <entryFree id="n3588" type="main" key="argu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum</itype> (ŭĭtum, hence arguiturus, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 882</bibl> P.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)rgh/s</foreign>, white; <foreign lang="greek">a)rgo/s</foreign>, bright; Sanscr. árgunas, bright; ragatas, white; and rag, to shine (v. argentum and argilla); after the same analogy we have clarus, bright; and claro, to make bright, to make evident; and the Engl. <itype>clear</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, and to clear = to make clear; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:page=171" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> p. 171</bibl></etym>. <sense id="n3588.0" n="I. A." level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>, <cb n="ARGU" /> <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assert</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">mhnu/ein</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">arguo Eam me vidisse intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ex auditu arguo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Valerius Laevinus ... speculatores, non legatos, venisse arguebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">degeneres animos timor arguit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amantem et languor et silentium Arguit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 13, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, in a mid. signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">apparet virtus arguiturque malis,</quote> <trans><tr>makes itself known</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:80" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudibus arguitur vini vinosus Homerus,</quote> <trans><tr>betrays himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3588.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n3588.2" n="a" level="4"> With aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to attempt to show</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">in one's case</hi>, <hi rend="ital">against him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge with</hi>: Indicāsse est detulisse; <cit><quote lang="la">arguisse accusāsse et convicisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:197" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 197</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=22" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 22</bibl>: Argutum iri in discrimen vocari): tu delinquis, ego arguar pro malefactis? Enn. (as transl. of Eurip. Iphig. Aul. 384: <foreign lang="greek">*ei)=t) e)gw\ di/khn dw= sw=n kakw=n o( mh\ sfalei/s</foreign>) ap. Rufin. § <cit><quote lang="la">37: servos ipsos neque accuso neque arguo neque purgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:41:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 41, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergin, sceleste, intendere hanc arguere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae tabellae te arguunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an hunc porro tactum sapor arguet oris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod adjeci, non ut arguerem, sed ne arguerer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:53:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 53, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram aliquem arguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud praefectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Deus) arguit te heri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:31:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 31, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Lev. 19, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Tim. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:3:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 3, 19 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3588.3" n="b" level="4"> With the cause of complaint in the <hi rend="ital">gen.; abl.</hi> with or without <hi rend="ital">de;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">in with abl.;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">a clause as object;</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (cf. Ramsh. p. 326; Zumpt, § 446). </sense><sense id="n3588.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum facinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 56</bibl></cit> (cf. infra, argutus, B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem probri, Stupri, dedecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros mortuos summi sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem tanti facinoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furti me arguent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:30:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 30, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccl. 11, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetundarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupandae rei publicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneni in se comparati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris arguemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:40 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 19, 40 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n3588.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">te hoc crimine non arguo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3588.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eo crimine, quo de arguatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv 2, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quibus quoniam verbo arguit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis arguet me de peccato?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 8, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3588.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in with abl.</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">non in sacrificiis tuis arguam te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 49, 8</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: quid undas Arguit et liquidam molem camposque natantīs? <hi rend="ital">of what does he impeach the waves?</hi> etc., quid being here equivalent to cujus or de quo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 405</bibl> Munro.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With an <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause as object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (mulier) me arguit Hanc domo ab se subripuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidisse patrem Sex. Roscius arguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor illius injuriae fuisse arguebatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sibimet vim ferro intulisse arguebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me Arguit incepto rerum accessisse labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 297</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 504</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">w(s</foreign> (post-Aug. and rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ut dominum et tyrannum, illum ut proditorem arguentes,</quote> <trans><tr>as being master and tyrant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3588.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the thing. </sense><sense id="n3588.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To accuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea culpa, quam arguo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata coram omnibus argue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni plebis dum arguunt in C. Caesare regni voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:68" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taciturnitatem pudoremque quorumdam pro tristitiā et malignitate arguens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arguebat et perperam editos census,</quote> <trans><tr>he accused of giving a false statement of property</tr>, <tr>census</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primusque animalia mensis Arguit imponi,</quote> <trans><tr>censured</tr>, <tr>taught that it was wrong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non arguantur opera ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3588.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to denounce as false</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod et ipsum Fenestella arguit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. p. 292" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Ter. p. 292</bibl></cit> Roth.—With reference to the person, <hi rend="ital">to refute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">argūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n3588.11" n="A" level="2"> Of physical objects, <hi rend="ital">clear.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3588.12" n="1" level="3"> To the sight, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glancing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus autem minus arguta, digitis subsequens verba, non exprimens,</quote> <trans><tr>not too much in motion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 220</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl>: nullae argutiae digitorum, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3</bibl>, <pb n="160" /> <cb n="ARGU" /> 119-123): <cit><quote lang="la">manus inter agendum argutae admodum et gestuosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et oculi nimis arguti, quem ad modum animo affecti sumus, loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argutum caput,</quote> <trans><tr>a head graceful in motion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 80</bibl></cit> (breve, Servius, but this idea is too prosaic): aures breves et argutae, <hi rend="ital">ears that move quickly</hi> (not stiff, rigid), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argutā in soleā,</quote> <trans><tr>in the neat sandal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3588.13" n="2. a." level="1"> To the hearing, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piercing</hi>, both of pleasant and disagreeable sounds, <hi rend="ital">clear-sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whizzing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rattling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clashing</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): linguae, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 9, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirundo,</quote> <trans><tr>chirping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olores,</quote> <trans><tr>tuneful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 36</bibl></cit>: ilex, <hi rend="ital">murmuring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustling</hi> (as moved by the wind), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 22</bibl></cit> al.—Hence, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of the musician and poet, <hi rend="ital">clear-sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melodious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neaera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama est arguti Nemesis formosa Tibullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:73:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 73, 7</bibl></cit>: forum, <hi rend="ital">full of bustle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">din</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> A.A. 1, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serra,</quote> <trans><tr>grating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecten,</quote> <trans><tr>rattling</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 294</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 14</bibl> (cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kerki\s a)oido/s</foreign>, Aristoph. Ranae, v. 1316) al.—Hence, of <hi rend="ital">rattling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verbose</hi> discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">sine virtute argutum civem mihi habeam pro preaeficā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">[Neque mendaciloquom neque adeo argutum magis],</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 163</bibl></cit> Ritschl.—</sense><sense id="n3588.14" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of written communications, <hi rend="ital">rattling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wordy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verbose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam mihi litteras quam argutissimas de omnibus rebus crebro mittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: vereor, ne tibi nimium arguta haec sedulitas videatur, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to omens, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclusive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly indicative</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui vel argutissima haec exta esse dicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tibi candidus argutum sternuit omen Amor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3588.15" n="3" level="3"> To the smell; <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pungent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor argutior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3588.16" n="4" level="3"> To the taste; <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pungent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3588.17" n="B" level="2"> Of mental qualities. </sense><sense id="n3588.18" n="1" level="3"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sagacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis illo (sc. Catone) acerbior in vituperando? in sententiis argutior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 17, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 70, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma facit ita festivum, ita concinnum, ita elegans, nihil ut fieri possit argutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dicta argutissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A.
