P. 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arguto ficta dolore queri,</quote> <trans><tr>dexterously-feigned pain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:26 al" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 26 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3588.19" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">sly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 40</bibl></cit>: calo. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—As a pun: ecquid argutus est? <hi rend="ital">is he cunning? Ch.</hi> Malorum facinorum saepissime (i.e. <hi rend="ital">has been accused of</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 56</bibl> (v. supra, I. B. a.).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">argūtē</orth> (only in the signif. of B.). </sense><sense id="n3588.20" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subtly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acutely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 28, 98</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 42</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re argutissime disputare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3588.21" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Craftily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obrepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argus: <entryFree id="n3589" type="main" key="Argus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/argos</foreign>. <sense id="n3589.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The hundred-eyed keeper of Io</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after she was changed into a heifer by Jupiter;</hi> slain by Mercury at the bidding of Jupiter. His hundred eyes were placed by Juno in the tail of the peacock, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:625 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 625 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 385</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 20</bibl> (cf. Eustath. ad Hom. Il. 2, p. 138; Schol. ad Eurip. Phoen. v. 1123; Heyne, Apollod. p. 249 sq.).—</sense><sense id="n3589.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The builder of the ship Argo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:93" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 93</bibl> and 314.—</sense><sense id="n3589.2" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Argus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = Argivus; v. Argos, II. D.</sense></entryFree>
argutatio: <entryFree id="n3590" type="hapax" key="argu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>argutor</etym>, <sense id="n3590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rustling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creaking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
argutator: <entryFree id="n3591" type="hapax" key="argu_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subtle disputant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argutatrix: <entryFree id="n3592" type="main" key="argu_ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>argutator</etym>, <sense id="n3592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prattling female</hi>, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. lingulaca, p. 117 Müll.; v. Müll. a. h. l.</sense></entryFree>
argute: <entryFree id="n3593" type="main" key="argu_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. arguo, <sense id="n3593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
argutiae: <entryFree id="n3594" type="main" key="argu_ti^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūtĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (the <number>sing.</number> argutia, ae, is rare and only among later writers; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 20</bibl>, and Phocae Ars, p. 1708 P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>argutus</etym>. <sense id="n3594.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which is clear to the senses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor of expression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liveliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animation;</hi> of works of art: Parrhasius primus symmetriam picturae dedit, primus argutias vultūs, elegantiam capilli, etc., Plin. <cb n="ARIA" /> 35, 10, 36, § <cit><quote lang="la">37: argutiae operum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 34, 18, 19, § 65</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the quick motion of the fingers</hi> (cf. argutus): <cit><quote lang="la">nulla mollitia cervicum, nullae argutiae digitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the chattering notes of the nightingale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 85</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">chattering discourse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3594.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to mental qualities. </sense><sense id="n3594.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Brightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acuteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus (C. Titii) orationes tantum argutiarum, tantum urbanitatis habent, ut paene Attico stilo scriptae esse videantur. Easdem argutias in tragoedias transtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:167" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 45, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes nihil Lysiae subtilitate cedit, nihil argutiis et acumine Hyperidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:31:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 31, 110</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3594.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Slyness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtlety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewdness in speech</hi> or <hi rend="ital">action</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nihil est quod illi (Graeci) non persequantur suis argutiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus loquacitas habet aliquid argutiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—In this signif. also in the <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">importuna atque audax argutia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis et quasi dicax argutia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. argutiola); Pall. Insit. prooem. 1; so <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argutiola: <entryFree id="n3595" type="main" key="argu_ti^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūtĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>argutiae, q. v. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n3595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piece of slyness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subtlety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cavil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quirk</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">quibble</hi> (only in Gell.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:7:9" default="NO">2, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:1:12" default="NO">18, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arguto: <entryFree id="n3596" type="main" key="argu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. argutor, I. <sense id="n3596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
argutor: <entryFree id="n3597" type="main" key="argu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (archaic <sense id="n3597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> argutarier, Titin.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>) [argutus] (except in Prop. only ante-class.), <hi rend="ital">to make a noise.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3597.1" n="I" level="1"> With the voice, <hi rend="ital">to prattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argutari dicitur loquacium proloqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 245, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exerce linguam ut argutarier possis, Enn. ap. Non. l. c. (Trag. v. 345 Vahl.): totum diem argutatur quasi cicada, Novat. ib. (Com. Rel. p. 218 Rib.): superare aliquem argutando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Fragm. ib. p. 67, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 193</bibl>: agite, fures, mendaciā argutari, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 239, 15</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">illa mihi totis argutat noctibus ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3597.2" n="II" level="1"> With the feet; of the fuller, <hi rend="ital">to stamp</hi>: Terra istaec est, non aqua, ubi tu solitu's argutarier Pedibus, cretam dum compescis, vestimenta qui laves, *Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 245, 32</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 137 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
argutulus: <entryFree id="n3598" type="main" key="argu_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūtŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n3598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.]. *</sense><sense id="n3598.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little noisy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talkative</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">loquacious</hi> (v. argutus, A. 2. a.): <cit><quote lang="la">famula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 117, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3598.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Somewhat subtle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keen</hi> (v. argutus, B. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
argutus: <entryFree id="n3599" type="main" key="argu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. arguo.</entryFree>
argynnus: <entryFree id="n3600" type="main" key="Argynnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argynnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/argunnos</foreign>, <sense id="n3600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boy from Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loved by Agamemnon;</hi> he was drowned in the river Cephisus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:6:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 6, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argyranche: <entryFree id="n3601" type="greek" key="argy^ranche_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argyranchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rgura/gxh</foreign>, <sense id="n3601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sarcastic word formed in imitation of</hi> <foreign lang="greek">suna/gxh</foreign> (inflammation of the throat), <hi rend="ital">the silver quinsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 9</bibl>; cf. Pollux Onomast. 7, 24, and synanche.</sense></entryFree>
argyraspis: <entryFree id="n3602" type="greek" key="argy^raspis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argyraspis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rgu/raspis</foreign>, <sense id="n3602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a silver shield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armed with a silver shield</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argyrippa: <entryFree id="n3603" type="main" key="Argy^rippa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argyrippa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Argyrĭpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arguri/ppa</foreign> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 246</bibl>, compounded of Argos Hippion), <sense id="n3603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Apulia</hi>, afterwards called <hi rend="ital">Arpi</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Arpa</hi>: Argyripa, Verg. l. c. Rib.; cf. Mann. Ital. II. 83; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 104</bibl> Jan.</sense></entryFree>
argyrippus: <entryFree id="n3604" type="main" key="Argy^rippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Argyrippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)argu/rippos</foreign>, <sense id="n3604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argyritis: <entryFree id="n3605" type="greek" key="argy^ri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argyrītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rguri=tis</foreign> (containing silver), <sense id="n3605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of silver dross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">litharge of silver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 106</bibl>.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">argyrŏcŏrinthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">made of Corinthian brass</hi> (which was similar in lustre to silver; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 3</bibl>): CRATERA, Inscr. (A. D. 149) Orell. 1541.</sense></entryFree>
argyrodamas: <entryFree id="n3606" type="greek" key="argy^ro^da^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argyrŏdămas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rguroda/mas</foreign>, <sense id="n3606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a silver-colored stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similar to the diamond</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
argyros: <entryFree id="n3607" type="greek" key="argy^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">argyros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called</hi> mercurialis, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arhythmus: <entryFree id="n3608" type="main" key="arhythmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arhythmus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">arhythmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)-r(uqmo/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n3608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of unequal measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inharmonious</hi>, only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9</bibl>, pp. 327, 328.</sense></entryFree>
aria: <entryFree id="n3609" type="main" key="A^ri_^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărī^a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arei/a</foreign> acc. to Arrian, or <foreign lang="greek">*)ari/a</foreign> acc. to Strabo and Ptolem. (cf. Crusius, Lex. of Proper Names), <sense id="n3609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Persian province between Hyrcania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gedrosia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and India</hi>, now the western part of Chorasan; <cb n="ARID" /> hence, with the appel. Ariana, q. v., Manil 4, 802; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 25, § 93</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Arĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n3609.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The inhabitants of the above country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 25, 29, § 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3609.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tribe of the Lygii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3610" type="main" key="A^ri^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ari/a</foreign>, <sense id="n3610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Pontus Euxinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 12, 13, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ariadna: <entryFree id="n3611" type="main" key="A^ri^adna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĭadna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>nom.</case> Ariadna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 35</bibl>: <sense id="n3611.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Ariadne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 255" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 255</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:270" default="NO">270</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ARIADNES, Corp. Inscr. 5, 3782: <case>acc.</case> Ariadnen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 43" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:224" default="NO">224</bibl>: <case>abl.</case> Ariadne, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:ib. 42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 42</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aria/dnh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Minos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Crete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who extricated Theseus from the Labyrinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and accompanied him on his return to Greece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but was deserted by him at Naxos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Bacchus fell in love with her and placed her crown as a constellation in the heavens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 35</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:462" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 462</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:18" default="NO">2, 3, 18</bibl>.—Also in prose, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĭadnae-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ariadnai=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Ariadne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ariadnœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:346" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ariana: <entryFree id="n3612" type="main" key="A^ri^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĭāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a general name of the eastern provinces of the great Persian kingdom</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Afghanistan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:23:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 25</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Ariana</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 25, § 93</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Ariana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 25, 29, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arianis: <entryFree id="n3613" type="main" key="a^ri^a_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărĭānis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba), = <foreign lang="greek">a)riani/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant growing wild in Ariana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 162</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arianus: <entryFree id="n3614" type="main" key="A^ria_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăriānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n3614.0" n="I" level="1"> From Ariana, q. v.—</sense><sense id="n3614.1" n="II" level="1"> From 2. Arius, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
aricia: <entryFree id="n3615" type="main" key="A^ri_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărīcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood of Alba Longa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon the Appian Way</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">La Riccia;</hi> acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 762</bibl> (v. II. infra), named from the wife of its founder, Hippolytus. Near it was a grove consecrated to Diana, in which at a very early age human victims were sacrificed; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, immitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:369" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 369</bibl></cit> (cf. Nemus and Nemorensis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 33, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2, p. 13</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. 633; Müll. Roms Camp. 2, 147-189.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3615.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărīcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Aricia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Arician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:68" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărīcīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitanls of Aricia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3615.2" n="II" level="1"> Personified, <hi rend="ital">a nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Hippolytus and mother of Virbius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 762</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aridaeus: <entryFree id="n3616" type="main" key="A^ri^daeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĭdaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aridai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n3616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a natural son of Philip of Macedon by the dancer Philinna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother and successor of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15 al" default="NO">12, 15 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 17</bibl>.—Also called Philippus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 3, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ariditas: <entryFree id="n3617" type="main" key="a_ri^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ārĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aridus</etym>, <sense id="n3617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dryness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drought.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3617.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ariditatem ampliare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 35, 41, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtus siccata usque in ariditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 29, 37, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ariditas aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.—In the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ariditatibus temperamenta ferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3617.2" n="B" level="2"> In Pall. meton. (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">any thing dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withered</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">parched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fimi ariditate miscenda est, i. e. fimo arido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ariditatem recidere,</quote> <trans><tr>the dry</tr>, <tr>dead wood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3617.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a being withered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dryness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipula ariditate plena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,042:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Nah. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchium ejus ariditate siccabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Zach. 11, 17</bibl></cit>; and meton. (abstr. for concr.), of <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scanty food</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> 1, 1 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
aridulus: <entryFree id="n3618" type="hapax" key="a_ri^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ārĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n3618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat dry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 317</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aridus: <entryFree id="n3619" type="main" key="a_ri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ārĭdus</orth> (contr. ardus, like arfacio from arefacio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 18</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 74, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 207</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>areo</etym>, <sense id="n3619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parched.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3619.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:881" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 881</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 56, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 809</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 864</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficis victitamus aridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 97</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libye,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale portentum Jubae tellus leonum Arida nutrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra arida et sicca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 65, 66, § 166</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terra arida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arida terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 11, 29</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arida (eccl. Lat.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:65:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 65, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 23, 15</bibl>: montes aridi sterilesque. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 67</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ārĭdum</orth>, <pb n="161" /> <cb n="ARIE" /> <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dry place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex arido tela conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves in aridum subducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of thirst: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:917" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 917</bibl></cit>, and 6, 1175; so, <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 200</bibl></cit>: guttur, Ov. [ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 422</bibl>].—Of a fever: <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>causing thirst</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 458</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:875" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 875</bibl>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. Art. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of color: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor folio convoluto, arido colore,</quote> <trans><tr>like that of dried leaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 26, 59, § 129</bibl></cit>.—And of a <hi rend="ital">cracking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snapping</hi> sound, <hi rend="ital">as when dry wood is broken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aridus altis Montibus (incipit) audiri fragor,</quote> <trans><tr>a dry crackling noise begins to be heard in the high mountain forest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 357</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3619.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3619.3" n="A" level="2"> Of things which are dried, <hi rend="ital">shrunk up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrivelled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvis aridior puella passis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 32, 1</bibl></cit>; so from disease, <hi rend="ital">withered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 3, 1</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">aridi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.— Hence, of food or manner of living, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scanty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in victu arido in hac horridā incultāque vitā,</quote> <trans><tr>poor</tr>, <tr>scanty diet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita horrida atque arida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Quinct. 30</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to men, <hi rend="ital">indigent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cliens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:87:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 87, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3619.4" n="B" level="2"> Of style, <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jejune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unadorned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spiritless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus sermonis exile, aridum, concisum ac minutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 159</bibl></cit>; so Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">narratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aridissimi libri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of the orator himself: <cit><quote lang="la">orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of scholars: sicci omnino atque aridi pueri,</quote> <trans><tr>sapless and dry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3619.5" n="C" level="2"> In comic lang., <hi rend="ital">avaricious</hi>, of a man from whom, as it were, nothing can be expressed (cf. Argentiexterebronides): <cit><quote lang="la">pumex non aeque est aridus atque hic est senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater avidus, miser atque aridus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n3619.6" n="D" level="2"> In Plaut. as a mere natural epithet of metal: arido argentost opus, <hi rend="ital">dry coin</hi>, Rud. 3, 4, 21.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> not used.</sense></entryFree>
ariena: <entryFree id="n3620" type="hapax" key="a^ri^e_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărĭēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fruit of the Indian tree</hi> pala, <hi rend="ital">the banana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 6, 12, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aries: <entryFree id="n3621" type="main" key="a^ri^e_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărĭēs</orth>, <itype>ĭētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (for the kindr. forms <orth extent="full" lang="la">arvix</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">harvix</orth>, in Varr. and Fest.; v. arvix; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> aries sometimes dissyl., like abies; hence, <sense id="n3621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> long, Carey, Lat. Pros. § 47: āriĕtis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 45</bibl>: āriĕtes, trisyl., Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">āriĕtĕ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 492</bibl></cit>) [some derive this from <foreign lang="greek">a)/rhn</foreign>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/rrhn</foreign>, qs. the <hi rend="ital">male</hi> sheep; others compare <foreign lang="greek">o( e)/rifos</foreign>, a he-goat, buck, and <foreign lang="greek">o( e)/lafos</foreign>, a stag; and arna, q. v.], <hi rend="ital">a ram.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3621.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:2:13" default="NO">2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:5" default="NO">7, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:6" default="NO">7, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Lev. 4, 35</bibl> et persaepe.—Of the golden fleece: petebant (Argonautae) illam pellem inauratam arietis Colchis, Enn. ap. Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:6 al" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 6 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3621.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3621.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Ram</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sign of the zodiac</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=230" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 230</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 133" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:221 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 59, § 221 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n3621.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An engine for battering down walls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a battering-ram</hi>: v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 14</bibl>, and Smith, Dict. Antiq.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis murum aries percusserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ariete materia defendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietibus aliquantum muri discussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:23" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 23</bibl>; 38, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 26, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Macc. 12, 15</bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n3621.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A beam for support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">buttress</hi>: quae (sublicae) pro ariete subjectae vim fluminis exciperent, <hi rend="ital">as a shore</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prop</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl> (<foreign lang="greek">di/khn kriou=</foreign>, Paraphr.); <cit><quote lang="la">corresp. to capreolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit> q. v.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo aries ille subicitur in vestris actionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:17:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 17, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3621.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An unknown sea-monster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very dangerous to ships</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 44, 67, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:11:53" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53</bibl> (where two kinds of them are mentioned); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 5, 4</bibl>: trux aries, Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 163; cf. Aelian. H. A. 15, 2, and Oppian. Hal. 1, 372.</sense></entryFree>
arietarius: <entryFree id="n3622" type="main" key="a^ri^e^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărĭĕtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aries</etym>, <sense id="n3622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to the battering-ram</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">machina ... testudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arietatio: <entryFree id="n3623" type="hapax" key="a^ri^e^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărĭĕtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arieto</etym>, <sense id="n3623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a butting like a ram</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arietinus: <entryFree id="n3624" type="main" key="a^ri^e^ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărĭĕtīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aries</etym>. <sense id="n3624.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from a ram</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ram's-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 8, 22, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3624.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Similar to a ram's head</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 32, § 124</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3624.2" n="III" level="1"> Arietinum oraculum,<cb n="ARIS" />  <hi rend="ital">an ambiguous oracle</hi> (the figure taken from the divergent horns of a ram), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 196</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
arieto: <entryFree id="n3625" type="main" key="a^ri^e^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărĭĕto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (arietat, trisyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 890</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:149" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:368" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 368</bibl>; cf. aries), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>aries</etym>, <sense id="n3625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to butt like a ram;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to strike violently</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or post-Aug. prose, esp. freq. in Seneca). </sense><sense id="n3625.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis illic est, qui tam proterve nostras aedes arietat?</quote> <trans><tr>beats so violently at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietare in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietata inter se arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietatos inter se dentes, id. Ira, 3, 4: concurrentia tecta contrario ictu arietant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:198 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 82, 84, § 198 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n3625.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima insolita arietari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:section=11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 1, § 11</bibl></cit> Haase.—</sense><sense id="n3625.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: in me arietare, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietat in portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 890</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et labaris oportet et arietes et cadas,</quote> <trans><tr>to stumble</tr>, <tr>totter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 107" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arificus: <entryFree id="n3626" type="hapax" key="a_ri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ārĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>areo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n3626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 1</bibl>, where some read <hi rend="ital">rarifica.</hi></sense></entryFree>
arii: <entryFree id="n3627" type="main" key="A^ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. 1. Aria.</entryFree>
arilator: <entryFree id="n3628" type="gloss" key="arila_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arilātor</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">arillātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a haggler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chafferer</hi>, = cocio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 20</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arimaspi: <entryFree id="n3629" type="main" key="A^ri^maspi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĭmaspi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arimaspoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n3629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian people in the north of Europe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl>; <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:756" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 756</bibl>; cf. Mann. Nord. pp. 143, 275.</sense></entryFree>
ariminum: <entryFree id="n3630" type="main" key="A^ri_mi^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărīmĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the shore of the Adriatic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the mouth of a river of the same name;</hi> the most northern place of Italy proper, connected with Rome by the Via Flaminia, now <hi rend="ital">Rimini</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 231</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. 455.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărīmĭnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Ariminum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:42" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 25, § 50</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărīmĭnenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Ariminum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:35:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 35, 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arinca: <entryFree id="n3631" type="foreign" key="arinca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arinca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gallic</etym>, <sense id="n3631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called</hi> olyra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 8, 19, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:92" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 10, 20, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:121" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 27, § 121</bibl>.— Acc. to Harduin, <hi rend="ital">rye</hi> (in Dauphiné, now <hi rend="ital">riguet</hi>); acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">the one-grained wheat</hi>: Triticum monococcum, Linn.</sense></entryFree>
ariobarzanes: <entryFree id="n3632" type="main" key="A^ri^o^barza_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĭŏbarzānes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ariobarza/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n3632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Cappadocia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ariola: <entryFree id="n3633" type="main" key="a^rio^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăriŏla, ăriŏlātio, ăriŏlor, ăriŏ-lus</orth>, v. hariŏla etc.</entryFree>
arion: <entryFree id="n3634" type="main" key="A^ri_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărīon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>nom.</case> Ario, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr. Ariona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:83 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 83 al.</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)ari/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n3634.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated cithara player of Methymna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Lesbos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rescued from drowning by a dolphin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:79" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 79</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19</bibl>; cf. Herod. 1, 23.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărīŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ario/nios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Arion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:93" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 326</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26, 18</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n3634.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A horse endowed with speech and the gift of prophecy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sent by Neptune to Adrastus;</hi> hence, vocalis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34:37" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34, 37</bibl> fata movens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:443" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 443</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adrastaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 555</bibl>, and Hom. Il. 23, 346.</sense></entryFree>
ariovistus: <entryFree id="n3635" type="main" key="Ariovistus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ariovistus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the king of a German tribe in the time of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
aris: <entryFree id="n3636" type="hapax" key="a^ris1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ri/s</foreign>, Galen (<foreign lang="greek">a)/ron</foreign>, <foreign lang="greek">a)ri/saron</foreign>, in Theophr. and Dioscor.), <sense id="n3636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of arum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dragon - root</hi> or <hi rend="ital">green dragon</hi>: Arum arisarum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 94, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3637" type="main" key="A^ris2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Sardinian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arisba: <entryFree id="n3638" type="main" key="A^risba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărisba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ari/sbh</foreign>. <sense id="n3638.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Troas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 125</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3638.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in the island of Lesbos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 39, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arista: <entryFree id="n3639" type="main" key="a^rista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. for acrista and akin to ācer, q. v., or perh. to aro, q. v.; cf. Germ. Aehre; Engl. ear (of corn); Germ. Ernte, harvest; Engl. earnest, fruit, pledge</etym>. <sense id="n3639.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The awn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beard of grain</hi>: arista, quae ut acus tenuis longa eminete glumā; <cit><quote lang="la">proinde ut granitheca sit gluma, et apex arista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3639.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (pars pro toto). </sense><sense id="n3639.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The ear itself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturae aristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:357" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguis arista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 720</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">an ear of spikenard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 398</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3639.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <cb n="ARIS" /> <hi rend="ital">summer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Post aliquot, mea regna videns, mirabor aristas,</quote> <trans><tr>after some harvests</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necdum decimas emensus aristas Aggrederis metuenda viris,</quote> <trans><tr>having measured ten summers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 371</bibl></cit> (cf. at the next grass, for <hi rend="ital">next summer</hi>, an expression still common in the north of England; so, seven years old at the next grass, Sylvester's Dubartas; just fifteen, coming summer's grass, Swift).—</sense><sense id="n3639.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., </sense><sense id="n3639.5" n="1" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">the hair of men</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:115" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 115</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n3639.6" n="2" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">the bones of fishes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">119</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3639.7" n="3" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">plants</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:365" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 365</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aristaeus: <entryFree id="n3640" type="main" key="A^ristaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aristai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n3640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Apollo and Cyrene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who is said to have taught to men the management of bees and the treatment of milk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and to have first planted olive - trees. He was the husband of Autonoë</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Actœon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 317</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57</bibl> Zumpt.</sense></entryFree>
aristarchus: <entryFree id="n3641" type="main" key="A^ristarchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ari/starxos</foreign>, <sense id="n3641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguisled critic of Alexandria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who animadverted with special severity upon the poetry of Homer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and contended that many of his verses were spurious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:9:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 9, 24</bibl>.—Appel. for <hi rend="ital">any critic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes meae, quarum tu Aristarchus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aristar-chēi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the disciples</hi>, <hi rend="ital">followers of Aristarchus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">severe critics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=63" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 63</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
aristatus: <entryFree id="n3642" type="hapax" key="a^rista_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăristātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arista</etym>, <sense id="n3642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having ears of corn</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=280" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 280</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ariste: <entryFree id="n3643" type="main" key="ariste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aristē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a precious stone</hi>, = encardia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aristides: <entryFree id="n3644" type="main" key="A^risti_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aristei/dhs</foreign>. <sense id="n3644.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Athenian renowned for his integrity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary and rival of Themistocles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 67, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 71</bibl>; his life was written by Cornelius Nepos and Plutarch.—</sense><sense id="n3644.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A painter of Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Apelles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3644.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A distinguished sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3644.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mathematician of Samos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Fragm. p. 256" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Fragm. p. 256</bibl> Bipp.—</sense><sense id="n3644.4" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An obscene poet of Miletus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of a poem</hi> Milesiaca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:413" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 413</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 443</bibl> Jahn.</sense></entryFree>
aristifer: <entryFree id="n3645" type="main" key="a^risti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăristĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arista-fero</etym>, <sense id="n3645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing ears of corn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aristiger: <entryFree id="n3646" type="gloss" key="a^risti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăristĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aristagero</etym>, <sense id="n3646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ear-bearing</hi>, an epithet of Ceres, as goddess of corn, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1493</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aristippus: <entryFree id="n3647" type="main" key="A^ristippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ari/stippos</foreign>, <sense id="n3647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a philosopher of Cyrene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disciple of Socrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founder of the Cyrenaic school</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui voluptatem summum bonum dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 18</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ari-stippēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Aristippus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aristius: <entryFree id="n3648" type="main" key="A^risti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n3648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens, e. g. Aristius Fuscus, <hi rend="ital">a learned poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhetorician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and grammarian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and an intimate friend of Horace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10</bibl> Schmid; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 61</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 83</bibl>, and Bähr, Gesch. d. Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> 52, n. 7; Teuffel, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 249, 1.</sense></entryFree>
aristo: <entryFree id="n3649" type="main" key="A^risto_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristō</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ari/stwn</foreign>, <sense id="n3649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a philosopher of Chios</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of Zeno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder of the sceptic philosophy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and contemporary of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aristōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Aristo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Aristonean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:15:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 15, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aristolochia: <entryFree id="n3650" type="greek" key="a^risto^lo^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăristŏlŏchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ristoloxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n3650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant useful in childbirth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">birthwort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 54, § 95</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aristoneus: <entryFree id="n3651" type="main" key="A^risto_ne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Aristo.</entryFree>
aristonicus: <entryFree id="n3652" type="main" key="A^risto^ni_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristŏnīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aristo/nikos</foreign>. <sense id="n3652.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Eumenes II.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Pergamus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who carried on war with the Romans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but was conquered by the consul M. Perpenna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and slain in prison</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 4, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3652.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Tyrant of Methymnœ in Lesbos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
aristophanes: <entryFree id="n3653" type="main" key="A^risto^pha^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristŏphănes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aristofa/nhs</foreign>. <sense id="n3653.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The most distinguished comic poet of Greece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from Lindus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the island of Rhodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Socrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3653.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv., </sense><sense id="n3653.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ări-stŏphănēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Aristophanean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anapaestus Aristophanius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:190" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 1818</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n3653.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristŏphănĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <pb n="162" /> <cb n="ARMA" /> the same, Hier. ad Isa. l. 15, c. 54, v. 11.— </sense><sense id="n3653.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A distinguished grammarian of Byzantium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pupil of Eratosthenes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and teacher of the critic Aristarchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aristophorum: <entryFree id="n3654" type="gloss" key="a^risto^pho^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăristŏphŏrum</orth> <itype>est vas, in quo prandium fertur, ut discus</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 23</bibl> Müll. [<foreign lang="greek">a)/riston</foreign> = prandium, and <foreign lang="greek">fe/rw</foreign> = fero].</entryFree>
aristosus: <entryFree id="n3655" type="hapax" key="a^risto_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăristōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arista</etym>, <sense id="n3655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in beards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">awns</hi>: cibaria, Venant. Ep. 9, 3.</sense></entryFree>
aristoteles: <entryFree id="n3656" type="main" key="A^risto^te^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristŏtĕles</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n3656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Aristoteli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 28</bibl>, like Archimedi, Achilli, Pericli; <case>acc.</case> Aristotelen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 60</bibl>; cf. Rudd. I. 58, n. 71; Neue, Formenl. I. pp. 181, 311), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aristote/lhs</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n3656.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Aristotle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a very learned and distinguished pupil of Plato</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from Stagira</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher of Alexander the Great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founder of the Peripatetic philosophy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 8, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35:141 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 35, 141 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3656.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristŏtĕlīus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Aristotelian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigmenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Topica Aristotelea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3656.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A guest of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aristoxenus: <entryFree id="n3657" type="main" key="A^ristoxe^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăristoxĕnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aristo/cenos</foreign>, <sense id="n3657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a philosopher and musician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pupil of Aristotle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:132 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 132 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
arithmetica: <entryFree id="n3658" type="greek" key="a^rithme_ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărithmētĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)riqmhtikh/</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">te/xnh</foreign>), <sense id="n3658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">arithmetic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the science of numbers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arithmetica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">arithmetice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arithmeticus: <entryFree id="n3659" type="greek" key="a^rithme_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărithmētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)riqmhtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to arithmetic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arithmetical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ărithmētĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">arithmetic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arithmeticis satis exercitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
arithmus: <entryFree id="n3660" type="greek" key="a^rithmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărithmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)riqmo/s</foreign> (number); <number>plur.</number> Arithmi, <sense id="n3660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name of the fourth book of Moses</hi> (in pure Lat., Numeri), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 23</bibl> and 28.</sense></entryFree>
