aritudo: <entryFree id="n3661" type="main" key="a_ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ārĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aridus</etym>, <sense id="n3661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dryness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aridity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drought</hi> (ante-class.): ariditas, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=60" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 60</bibl> Müll. (Epicharm. v. 2 Vahl. p. 167); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 40</bibl>; also in <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 71, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arius: <entryFree id="n3662" type="main" key="A^ri_^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărī^us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/areios</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*)/arios</foreign>, <sense id="n3662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Aria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Heri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 25, § 93</bibl>; in <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Arias.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3663" type="main" key="A^ri_^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărī^us</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Arr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arei=os</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*)/arios</foreign>, <sense id="n3663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renowned heretic</hi>, also Ārĭus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 794</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărīānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Arius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Arian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Lucif. 7</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărīāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the followers of Arius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Arians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Lucif. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Haeres. 49" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Haeres. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ariusius: <entryFree id="n3664" type="main" key="A^ri^u_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărĭūsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: vina, <sense id="n3664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine of the region of Ariusia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the island Chios</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*)ariousi/a xw/ra</foreign>, Strabo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:210" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 210</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arma: <entryFree id="n3665" type="main" key="arma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n3665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> armūm, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 155</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 495, 23</bibl>, considered by Cic. in the connection armūm judicium as less correct than armorum) [cf. <foreign lang="greek">*a*r*w, a)rari/skw</foreign> = to fit; <foreign lang="greek">a)/rqron</foreign> = joint; <foreign lang="greek">a(rmo/s</foreign> = armus = joint, shoulder; <foreign lang="greek">a)rta/w</foreign> = artio, arto = to fit, to fit in closely; <foreign lang="greek">a)/rtios</foreign> = fit, exact; artus = close, narrow; ars (artis) = the craft of fitting things; artifex, artificium; Goth. arms = O. H. Germ. aram = Engl. arm; Sanscr. ar = to hit upon, attain; aram = fit, fast; īrmas = arm. Curt.]. </sense><sense id="n3665.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3665.2" n="A. 1." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">What is fitted</hi> to the body for its protection, <hi rend="ital">defensive armor</hi>, as the shield, coat of mail, helmet, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tot milia armorum, detracta corporibus hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">induere arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma his imperata, galea, clipeum, ocreae, lorica, omnia ex aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictis et auro caelatis refulgens armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3665.3" n="2" level="3"> Specifically, <hi rend="ital">a shield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Lausum socii exanimem super arma ferebant,</quote> <trans><tr>on a shield</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:841" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 841</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestia arma, quae ancilia appellantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit> (v. ancile); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 37</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 119</bibl> Heyne; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 11</bibl> Rup.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneas se collegit in arma,</quote> <trans><tr>gathered himself under his shield</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 491</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in a more extended sense, </sense><sense id="n3665.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Implements of war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">both of defence and offence</hi> (but of the latter only those which are used <cb n="ARMA" /> in close contest, such as the sword, axe, club; in distinction from <hi rend="ital">tela</hi>, which are used in contest at a distance; hence, arma and tela are often contrasted; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>, and cf. Bremi and Dähne ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 11, 3</bibl>): arma rigent, horrescunt tela, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 469, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma alia ad tegendum, alia ad nocendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caec. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis condicione positis aut defetigatione abjectis aut victoriā detractis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum dicis cum armis aureis, Quoius etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi Simul rem et gloriam armis belli repperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma antiqua manus, ungues dentesque fuerunt Et lapides, et item, silvarum fragmina, ramei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1283</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Mutum et turpe pecus (i. e. primeval man), glandem et cubilia propter Unguibus et pugnis, dein fustibus, atque ita porro Pugnabant armis, quae post fabricaverat usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 100</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 6</bibl> and 7: <cit><quote lang="la">sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 36, 88</bibl></cit> Wund.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:22:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 3 Reg. 22, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere, ib. Judith, 14, 2: adprehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aptare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">induere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 798</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:521" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 521</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accingi armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 184</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 18, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis instructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Deut. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Par. 12, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitare ad arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">descendere ad arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocare ad arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocare in arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre contra aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decernere armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis cum hoste certare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:22:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 22, 87</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">saevis armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 890</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicare armis cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere, abicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 5, 43</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 44: deripere militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 104</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, arma virosque, per arma, per viros, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30 al" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 30 al.</bibl>; v. Burm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl>, and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela et arma: armorum atque telorum portationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 42, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 29</bibl> and 33: <cit><quote lang="la">armis et castris, prov. (like remis velisque, viris equisque),</quote> <trans><tr>with vigor</tr>, <tr>with might and main</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3665.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">means of protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weapons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere semper arma (sc. eloquentiae), quibus vel tectus ipse esse possis, vel, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4</bibl></cit>. 9: <cit><quote lang="la">tectus Vulcaniis armis, id est fortitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Cor. 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma lucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horriferum contra Borean ovis arma ministret, i. e. lanas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec mihi Stertinius arma (i. e. praecepta) dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 297</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma militiae nostrae non carnalia sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 10, 4</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n3665.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">War</hi> (once in opp. to pax, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">silent leges inter arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma civilia,</quote> <trans><tr>civil war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilia arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 37</bibl> (otherwise, bella civilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 86</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 13</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ab externis armis otium erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 69</bibl> Drak.; 9, 32; 42, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Rubro Mari arma conatus sit inferre Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 1</bibl></cit> (for which more freq. bellum inferre alicui, v. infero): <cit><quote lang="la">ad horrida promptior arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fera nuntiet arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 479: compositis venerantur armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 52</bibl></cit>. So the beginning of the Æneid: Arma virumque cano; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius visum Gallos novam gentem pace potius cognosci quam armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cedant arma togae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 76</bibl></cit>.—Also for <hi rend="ital">battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arma feror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 337</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 655</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3665.7" n="b" level="4"> (Abstr. for concr.) <hi rend="ital">The warriors themselves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla usquam apparuerunt arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostro supplicio liberemus Romana arma, i. e. Romanum exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispanias armis non ita redundare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expertem frustra belli et neutra arma secutum,</quote> <trans><tr>neither party</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 91</bibl></cit>: auxiliaria arma, <hi rend="ital">auxiliaries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auxiliary troops</hi> = auxiliares (v. auxiliaris, I.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:424" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 424</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:528" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 528</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3665.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> (like <foreign lang="greek">o(/plon</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">e)/ntea</foreign> in Gr.), <hi rend="ital">implements</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tools</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utensils</hi>, in gen. <cb n="ARMA" /> Of <hi rend="ital">implements for grinding and baking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerealia arma,</quote> <trans><tr>the arms of Ceres</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 177</bibl></cit> (cf. Hom. Od. 7, 232: <foreign lang="greek">e)/ntea daito/s</foreign>). —Of <hi rend="ital">implements of agriculture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendum est, quae sint duris agrestibus arma, Quīs sine nec potuere seri nec surgere messes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 160</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the equipments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tackle of a ship</hi> (<hi rend="ital">mast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sails</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudder</hi>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">colligere arma jubet validisque incumbere remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 353</bibl>.—Hence used by Ovid for <hi rend="ital">wings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec umeris arma parata suis, A. A. 2, 50 (cf. in the foll. verse: his patria est adeunda carinis).—And so of other instruments,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:36" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
armamaxa: <entryFree id="n3666" type="greek" key="arma^maxa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armămaxa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(rma/maca</foreign>, <sense id="n3666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covered Persian chariot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially for women and children</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
armamenta: <entryFree id="n3667" type="main" key="arma_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armāmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>arma, III.</etym>, <sense id="n3667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">implements</hi> or <hi rend="ital">utensils for any purpose.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3667.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">armamenta vinearum,</quote> <trans><tr>props</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armamenta ad inclusos cantus,</quote> <trans><tr>reeds</tr>, <tr>pipes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 170</bibl></cit>: Excussis inde tunicis iterum iisdem armamentis nudata conciditur medulla, i.e. <hi rend="ital">with mortar and pestle</hi> = pilā ligneā, which he had used just before, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 112</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3667.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the tackle of a ship</hi> (<hi rend="ital">sails</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ropes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cables</hi>, etc.): armamentūm stridor, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 87</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ac.</hi> Salvast navis: ne time. <hi rend="ital">Cha.</hi> Quid alia armamenta? <hi rend="ital">Ac.</hi> Salva et sana sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 80</bibl>: omnia caute armamenta locans, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=197" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 197</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tormenta, armamenta, arma, omnis apparatus belli est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 43</bibl></cit>: armamenta navis projecerunt, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aptarique suis pinum jubet armamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 456</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl>.—Sometimes the sails are excepted: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis Gallicis navibus spes in velis armamentisque consisteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
armamentarium: <entryFree id="n3668" type="main" key="arma_menta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armāmentārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>armamenta</etym>, <sense id="n3668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an arsenal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aedibus sacris armamentariisque publicis arma populo Romano dantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Philo) Atheniensibus armamentarium fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 38, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:14:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 14, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:23" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 23</bibl>; 42, 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 975 al.</bibl>—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid habent telorum armamentaria caeli,</quote> <trans><tr>the arsenals of heaven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
armariolum: <entryFree id="n3669" type="main" key="arma_rio^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armāriŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>armarium</etym>, <sense id="n3669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little chest</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">casket</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">armariola Graeca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">A small cabinet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bookcase</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Matth. 3, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
armarium: <entryFree id="n3670" type="main" key="arma_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>arma</etym>, <sense id="n3670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a closet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chest</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">money</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">armarium promptuarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reclusit armarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset in aedibus armarium, in quo sciret esse nummorum aliquantum et auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 21, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repositus in arcis armariisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armarium muricibus praefixum,</quote> <trans><tr>the box</tr>, <tr>set with sharp spikes</tr>, <tr>in which Regulus was put to death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
armatura: <entryFree id="n3671" type="main" key="arma_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>armo</etym>, <sense id="n3671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">armor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equipment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3671.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatura varia peditatūs et equitatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes nostrā armaturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidae levis armaturae,</quote> <trans><tr>of light armor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universi generis armatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 32, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 26, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3671.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">armed soldiers;</hi> and in class. lang. always with the <pos>adj.</pos> levis, = velites, <hi rend="ital">light-armed soldiers</hi> (opp. gravis armatus). Veg. first used armatura <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> for <hi rend="ital">young troops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae sunt legiones, nostra levis armatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites, pedites, levis armatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 37, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsequi cum levi armaturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:49" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum triginta, levis armaturae centum milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:18" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipuli levis armaturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis armaturae juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n3671.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3671.4" n="A" level="2"> Of discourse: haec fuerit nobis, tamquam levis armaturae, prima orationis excursio; <cit><quote lang="la">nunc comminus agamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3671.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of exercise in arms</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3671.6" n="C" level="2"> In a religious sense (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">induite armaturam Dei,</quote> <trans><tr>the armor of God</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ephes. 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 13</bibl>. <pb n="163" /> <cb n="ARME" /></sense></entryFree>
armatus: <entryFree id="n3672" type="main" key="arma_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from armo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3673" type="main" key="arma_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>armo</etym>, <sense id="n3673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">armor</hi> (only in the <case>abl.</case>). </sense><sense id="n3673.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud dispari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cretico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatu sustinendo assueti milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Prim. Hist. Fragm. 2, p. 341" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Prim. Hist. Fragm. 2, p. 341</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3673.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">armed soldiers</hi> (cf. armatura, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">gravi armatu,</quote> <trans><tr>with the heavy-armed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā parte impedimentorum relictā in Bruttiis, et omni graviori armatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
armenia: <entryFree id="n3674" type="main" key="Arme^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Armĕnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)armeni/a</foreign>. <sense id="n3674.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A country of Asia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divided into</hi> Armenia Major (eastern, now Turcomania and Kurdistan) and Minor (western, now Anatolia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 9, 9, § 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utraeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> Armenia, for Armenia Minor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:37:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 37, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 94</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n3674.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n3674.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Armĕnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)armeniako/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Armenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 39, 40, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 2, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 47, § 164</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, Armeniacus,</quote> <trans><tr>an epithet of the emperor Marcus Aurelius</tr>, <tr>on account of his conquest of Armenia</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Anton. Philos. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 253, 2</bibl>.—Armeniacum malum, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Armĕnĭăcum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the fruit of the apricot-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the apricot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:404" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 404</bibl>, called Armenium).—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Armĕ-nĭăca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the apricot-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:96" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3674.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Armĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Armenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=100" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 100</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3674.4" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n3674.5" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ar-mĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an Armenian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:227" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:59" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:19:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 19, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3674.6" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Armĕnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n3674.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Sc. pigmentum, <hi rend="ital">a fine blue color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtained from an Armenian stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ultramarine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 12, § 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3674.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Sc. pomum, <hi rend="ital">the apricot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:404" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 404</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
armenta: <entryFree id="n3675" type="main" key="armenta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armenta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. armentum.</entryFree>
armentalis: <entryFree id="n3676" type="main" key="armenta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>armentum</etym>, <sense id="n3676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a herd of cattle</hi> (except once in Verg., only post-class.): equa, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 571</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:17" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2" default="NO">2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 166 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
armentarius: <entryFree id="n3677" type="main" key="armenta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a herd of cattle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equiso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3677.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">armentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n3677.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A herdsman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neat-herd</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia secum Armentarius Afer agit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 344</bibl></cit>: armentarius ego sum, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Amos, 7, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3677.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of the emperor Galerius Maximianus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose ancestors were shepherds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 40" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Ep. 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
armenticius: <entryFree id="n3678" type="main" key="armenti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armentīcĭus</orth> (better, <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to a herd of cattle</hi> (perh. only in Varr.): <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit> (Schne<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:in Veg. 1:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Veg. 1, 18</bibl> reads <hi rend="ital">armentiva</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
armentivus: <entryFree id="n3679" type="main" key="armenti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armentīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a herd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 17, 68, § 232</bibl> Hard.; besides, only <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 18</bibl> Schneid. var. lect.; v. armenticius <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
armentosus: <entryFree id="n3680" type="hapax" key="armento_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armentōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in herds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia armentosissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
armentum: <entryFree id="n3681" type="main" key="armentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">armenta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Liv. Andron. and Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 190, 20</bibl>; Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 4</bibl> Müll.) [contr. for arimentum from aro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=96" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 96</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 2</bibl>]. <sense id="n3681.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Cattle for ploughing;</hi> and collectively, <hi rend="ital">a herd</hi> (but jumentum, contr. for jugimentum from jugum, draught-cattle; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:89" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 89</bibl>); most freq. in the <number>plur.</number>: cornifrontes armentae, Liv. Andron. l. c.; <cit><quote lang="la">Enn. l. c.: At variae crescunt pecudes, armenta feraeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 228</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex armentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges armentorum reliquique pecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 28, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut accensis cornibus armenta concitentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta bucera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 395</bibl></cit>.—In the <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">armentum aegrotat in agris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pasci Armentum regale vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:842" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 842</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 882</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 348</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armentum agens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad armentum cucurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 18, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 29, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:43:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 43, 19</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n3681.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3681.2" n="A" level="2"> Of horses or other large animals: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum haec armenta minantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 540</bibl></cit>.— In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortiri armento subolem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:277" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 277</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 66, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:263" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 49, 110, § 263</bibl>: hos (cervos)<cb n="ARMI" />  tota armenta sequuntur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 185</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta immania Neptuni,</quote> <trans><tr>the monstrous beasts of Neptune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 395</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3681.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A herd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drove</hi>, as a collective designation; with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 195</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 8, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">ib. Judith, 2, 8: multa ibi equorum boumque armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cynocephalorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3681.4" n="C" level="2"> For <hi rend="ital">a single cow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ox</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">centum armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 118" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
armifer: <entryFree id="n3682" type="main" key="armi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arma-fero</etym>, <sense id="n3682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing weapons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warlike</hi> (perh. first used by Ov.; for the distinction between it and armiger, v. armiger, II.). </sense><sense id="n3682.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, as an epithet of Mars and Minerva: <cit><quote lang="la">armifer armiferae correptus amore Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:681" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me armiferae servatum cura Minervae eripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leleges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:645" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:45" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <trans><tr>labors of war</tr>, <tr>warfare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:96" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:831" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 6, 831</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3682.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvum,</quote> <trans><tr>the field in Colchis</tr>, <tr>sowed with dragons' teeth</tr>, <tr>from which armed men sprang up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 469" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 469</bibl></cit> (for which armigera humus in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:10:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 10, 10</bibl>, and armiger sulcus in <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Cons. Stil. 324</bibl>; v. armiger, I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
armiger: <entryFree id="n3683" type="main" key="armi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armĭger</orth> (ARMIGERVS in a late inscr., Orell. 3631), <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arma-gero</etym>, <sense id="n3683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing weapons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warlike</hi> (in this last sense rare, instead of armifer). </sense><sense id="n3683.1" n="I" level="1"> Pennigero non armigero in corpore, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum paucis armigeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebumque, armigerum deum (i. e. Martem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:87" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Colchis armigeră proelia sevit humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:10:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Cons. Stil. 324</bibl></cit>, i. q. armiferum arvum (v. armifer <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n3683.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">an armor-bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shield-bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a female armorbearer</hi> (this is the prevailing signif. of the word). </sense><sense id="n3683.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armiger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sergius armiger Catilinae,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>an adherent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regisque Thoactes Armiger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 148</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:363" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 363</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (Butes) Dardanio Anchisae Armiger ante fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocavit armigerum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:9:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 9, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Reg. 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Par. 10, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">armiger Jovis, i. e. aquila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 386</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 564</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 1</bibl>: minister fulminis ales): armiger hac magni patet Hectoris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the promontory of Misenus</hi>, named after Misenus, the armor-bearer of Hector, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:77" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3683.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armigera, of the armor-bearer of Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 619</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
armilausa: <entryFree id="n3684" type="main" key="armi^lausa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armĭlausa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, contr. from armiclausa</etym>, <sense id="n3684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a military upper garment</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 17</bibl>; Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
armile: <entryFree id="n3685" type="main" key="armi_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. armillum <sense id="n3685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
armilla: <entryFree id="n3686" type="main" key="armilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=25" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 25</bibl> Müll., from armus; acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1220</bibl> P., from arma</etym>. <sense id="n3686.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A circular ornament for the arm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bracelet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armlet</hi>, for men and women: <cit><quote lang="la">armillae, quae bracchialia vocantur, Cic. ap. Prisc. l. c.: Ubi illae armillae sunt, quas unā dedi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 26</bibl>: armillis decoratus, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipulum hastatorum armillis donavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 47, § 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armillas posui in manibus ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:24:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 24, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:23:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 23, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monilia et armillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 3, 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3686.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An iron hoop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferrule</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
armillatus: <entryFree id="n3687" type="main" key="armilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armillātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [armilla], <sense id="n3687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ornamented with a bracelet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armillatum in publicum procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armillata et phalerata turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">armillati colla Molossa canes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wearing on their necks the bracelets of their mistresses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:8:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 8, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
armillum: <entryFree id="n3688" type="main" key="armillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>acc. to Paul. ex Fest., from armus; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr></etym>, <sense id="n3688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel for wine</hi> (ante- and post-class.): armillum, quod est urceoli genus vinarii, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 547, 15</bibl>: armillum vas vinarium in sacris dictum, quod armo, id est humero deportetur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 2</bibl> Müll.—Hence the proverb, ad armillum revertere, or redire, or simply, ad armillum, <hi rend="ital">to return to one's old habits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin one's old tricks again</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 74, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at illa ad armillum revertit et ad familiares feminarum artes accenditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230, 22</bibl></cit>.—With a more pointed reference, Appuleius, speaking of Cupid, changes armillum in the proverb into armile = armamentarium, <hi rend="ital">an armory</hi>, M. 6, p. 132, 15. <cb n="ARMO" /></sense></entryFree>
armilustrium: <entryFree id="n3689" type="main" key="Armi^lustrium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Armĭlustrium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Roman festival of the consecration of arms;</hi> v. Armilustrum.</sense></entryFree>
armilustrum: <entryFree id="n3690" type="main" key="Armi^lustrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Armĭlustrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Rome</hi> (in the 13th district), <hi rend="ital">where was celebrated the festival</hi> Armilustrium, consecration of arms, <foreign lang="greek">o(plokaqarmo/s</foreign> (19th Oct.; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> II. p. 411</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Armilustrum ab ambitu lustri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=153" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 153</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armilustrium ab eo, quod in armilustrio armati sacra faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 22</bibl></cit> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=19" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 19</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
arminius: <entryFree id="n3691" type="main" key="Armi^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Armĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished Cheruscan prince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who defeated Varus in the Teutoburg forest</hi>, A.D. 9, <hi rend="ital">and thus freed Germany from the dominion of the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:118" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:32" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 63</bibl>; 2, 9; 2, 17; 2, 21; 2, 88 al.</sense></entryFree>
armipotens: <entryFree id="n3692" type="main" key="armi^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armĭ-pŏtens</orth>, <itype>pŏtentis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arma-potens</etym>, <sense id="n3692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">powerful in arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valiant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warlike;</hi> a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of Mars, Diana, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Mavors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:32 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 32 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deiphobus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ausonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:20" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
armipotentia: <entryFree id="n3693" type="hapax" key="armi^po^tenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armĭpŏtentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>armipotens</etym>, <sense id="n3693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">power in arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
armisonus: <entryFree id="n3694" type="main" key="armi^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armĭ-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arma-sono</etym>, <sense id="n3694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resounding with arms</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">numina Palladis armisonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 544</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
armita: <entryFree id="n3695" type="gloss" key="armi_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>armus</etym>, <sense id="n3695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a virgin sacrificing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the lappet of her toga thrown back over her shoulder</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 4</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
armites: <entryFree id="n3696" type="gloss" key="armi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armītes</orth>: <foreign lang="greek">o(pli=tai oi( e)n e)sxa/th| ta/cei</foreign>, <sense id="n3696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers of the rear-rank</hi>, Philox. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
armo: <entryFree id="n3697" type="main" key="armo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>arma</etym>. <sense id="n3697.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish with weapons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to arm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equip</hi>, aliquem or aliquem aliquā re: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in pace multitudinem hominum coëgerit, armārit, instruxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites armari jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quemque casus armaverat, sparos aut lanceas portabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestīsque manus armat sparus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 682</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos e gente suorum armet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 464</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 614</bibl>: milites iis armis armare, Pomp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tela, nunc saxa, quibus eos adfatim locus ipse armabat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se spoliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus ense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:182" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem facibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:12:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes aculeis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 33, § 46</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid aliquā re: ferrum armare veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 773</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamos veneno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontum vinclis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 657 al.</bibl></cit>—Followed by <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egentes in locupletes, perditi in bonos, servi in dominos armabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delecta juventus contra Milonis impetum armata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 25</bibl></cit>; for adversus, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>. —That for which one is armed, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unanimos armare in proelia fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armate viros ad pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 31, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3697.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3697.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To arm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritatem concitatae multitudinis auctoritate publicā armare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitavit, quibus accusatorem rebus armaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 67</bibl></cit>: te ad omnia summum ingenium armavit, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium senatūs auctoritas, Caesarem militum armavit fiducia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:49" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae gentes non telis magis quam suo caelo, suo sidere armantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:12:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese eloquentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se imprudentiā alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 544</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā cogitatione armamini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 4, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">Archilochum proprio rabies armavit iambo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugis armatus,</quote> <trans><tr>armed with nonsense</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armata dolis mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:183" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 183</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:682" default="NO">15, 682</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3697.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provoke;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hannibal) regem armavit et exercuit adversus Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad omnia armare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudii sententia consules armabat in tribunos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid vos in fata parentis Armat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixtus dolor et pudor armat in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exitium rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:12:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 12, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:1" default="NO">4, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3697.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To furnish with something needful</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">with the munitions of war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fit out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equip</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae sunt usui ad armandas naves, ex Hispaniā adportari jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri propugnaculis armabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 9</bibl></cit>: Claudius triremes quadriremesque <pb n="164" /> <cb n="ARNE" /> et undeviginti hominum milia armavit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 56</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">armātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">armed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equipped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitted with armor</hi> (opp. inermis, togatus, q. v.); also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">armātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an armed man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a solier</hi>, = miles. </sense><sense id="n3697.5" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n3697.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatos, si Latine loqui volumus, quos appellare vere possumus? opinor eos, qui scutis telisque parati ornatique sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 60</bibl></cit>: cum animatus iero satis armatus sum, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 233, 18</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">p. 495, 23: armati pergemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:32:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 32, 32</bibl></cit>; ib. Judith, 9, 6: ab dracontis stirpe armatā exortus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 426, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armata manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 629</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 636</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:640" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 640</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1297" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1297</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1292</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe ipsa plebes armata a patribus secessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra injurias armatus ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facibus armatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatus falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classes armatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatus cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3697.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">armati anni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>years spent in war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:591" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 591</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: excitati, erecti, armati animis, <hi rend="ital">armed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnished</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 26</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> only twice, and referring to the <hi rend="ital">pos.</hi> armatus in connection with it (<hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> never used), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 61</bibl> (v. the passage in its connection): <cit><quote lang="la">tam tibi par sum quam multis armatissimis nudi aut leviter armati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3697.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: gravidus armatis equus (sc.
