Trojanus), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 97 Müll.): armatos educere, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 355, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem triremem armatis ornat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem milia armatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Milt. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:38:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 38, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatis in litora expositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
armon: <entryFree id="n3698" type="foreign" key="armon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">armŏs</orth> = armoracia in the language of Pontus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 82</bibl>.</entryFree>
armoracia: <entryFree id="n3699" type="greek" key="armo^ra^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armŏrăcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">armŏrăcĕa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 11, 4</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">armŏ-răcium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">a)rmoraki/a</foreign>, <sense id="n3699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">horseradish</hi>: Cochlearia armoracia, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:20:4:12" default="NO">20, 4, 12</bibl>; cf. Dioscor. 2, 138.</sense></entryFree>
armoricae: <entryFree id="n3700" type="main" key="Armo^ri^cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Armŏrĭcae</orth> (later form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arēmŏrĭ-cae</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 9, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prof. 10, 15</bibl>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)armorikai/</foreign> [ar, Celt. and old Lat., = ar, on, and mor, Celt., = mare], <sense id="n3700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">some of the northern provinces of Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Bretagne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a part of Normandy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:8:31" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> 8, 31</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gall. 160.</sense></entryFree>
armosata: <entryFree id="n3701" type="main" key="Armo^sa^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Armŏsăta</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsamŏsăta</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 10</bibl>; Plin. l. l.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)armo/sata</foreign> Polyb., <foreign lang="greek">*)arsamo/sata</foreign> Ptol., <sense id="n3701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress in Armenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 9, 10, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
armus: <entryFree id="n3702" type="greek" key="armus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">armus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(rmo/s</foreign> [<foreign lang="greek">a)/rw</foreign>; v. arma <sense id="n3702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inct.</hi>], pr., a joining together; <hi rend="ital">the shoulder where it is fitted to the shoulder-blade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fore quarter</hi> (opp. suffrago), and, with few exceptions, of <hi rend="ital">the shoulder of an animal</hi>, while <hi rend="ital">umerus</hi> designates that of men. </sense><sense id="n3702.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: solus homo bipes: uni juguli, umeri; <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris armi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 43, 98, § 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digiti (Hippomenae in leonem mutati) curvantur in ungues: Ex umeris armi fiunt, Ov M. 10, 700.—So, elephantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 40, 95, § 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantherae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 17, 23, § 62</bibl></cit> et saep.: leporis, Hor S. 2, 4, 44; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 8, 89: equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:6:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 6, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 29, 27</bibl>.—Of men: <cit><quote lang="la">latos huic hasta per armos Acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 644</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Paul. ex Fest. s. v. armita, p. 4 Müll.—And of the arms of men,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 831</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n3702.2" n="II" level="1"> In a more extended sense, <hi rend="ital">the whole side of an animal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumantis equi fodere calcaribus armos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:881" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 881</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
armuzia: <entryFree id="n3703" type="main" key="Armuzi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Armuzĭa</orth> <itype>regio</itype>, <sense id="n3703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region in Caramania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 27, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arna: <entryFree id="n3704" type="main" key="Arna1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mile east of Perusia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Civitella d'Arno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:458" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 458</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 91</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. 483.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arnātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Arna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 90</bibl> and 5005.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3705" type="gloss" key="arna2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lamb</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 17</bibl> Müll. (v. aries <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
arnacis: <entryFree id="n3706" type="greek" key="arna^cis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arnăcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rnaki/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garment for maidens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a coat of sheepskin</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 543, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arnates: <entryFree id="n3707" type="main" key="Arna_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arnātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. Arna.</entryFree>
arne: <entryFree id="n3708" type="main" key="Arne_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/arnh</foreign>. <sense id="n3708.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:331" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 331</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3708.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of Bœotia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mataranga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 14, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3709" type="main" key="Arne_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/arnh</foreign>, <sense id="n3709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman who</hi> <cb n="AROM" /> <hi rend="ital">betrayed her country</hi> (<hi rend="ital">the island Siphnos</hi>), <hi rend="ital">and was changed into a jackdaw</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 465</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arniensis: <entryFree id="n3710" type="main" key="Arniensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arniensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Arnus.</entryFree>
arnion: <entryFree id="n3711" type="main" key="arnion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arnion</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/rnion</foreign>, v. arnoglossa.</entryFree>
arnobius: <entryFree id="n3712" type="main" key="Arno^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arnŏbĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n3712.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An African Church father in the time of Diocletian</hi>, c. A. D. 295. His work, Adversus Gentes, is distinguished by strength and purity of diction; cf. Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 639, 2.—</sense><sense id="n3712.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arnŏbĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">junior</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a theological author</hi>, c. A. D. 460, who wrote a Commentary on the Psalms; cf. Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 462, 1.</sense></entryFree>
arnoglossa: <entryFree id="n3713" type="greek" key="arnoglossa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arnoglossa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rno/glwsson</foreign>, <sense id="n3713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sheep's-tongue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plantain</hi>: Plantago major, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 1</bibl> (also called arnion; Isid., Orig. 17, 9, 50, calls it arnoglossos).</sense></entryFree>
arnus: <entryFree id="n3714" type="main" key="Arnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/arnos</foreign>, <sense id="n3714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Etruria</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Arno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:79 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 79 al.</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. 328.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Arnus</hi>: tribus, <hi rend="ital">situated on the Arnus</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 5</bibl>, settled A. U. C. 396, most distant from Rome, as Saburana was the nearest: <cit><quote lang="la">a Saburană usque ad Arniensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aro: <entryFree id="n3715" type="main" key="a^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)ro/w</foreign> = to plough, to till; <foreign lang="greek">a)/rotron</foreign> = aratrum; <foreign lang="greek">a)/rotos, a)/roura</foreign> = arvum, = Welsh ar; <foreign lang="greek">a)roth/r</foreign> = arator; armentum; Goth. arjan = to plough; O. H. Germ. aran = to ear</etym>, <sense id="n3715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to till.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3715.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3715.2" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arare mavelim quam sic amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fundo Fodere aut arare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidem L. Quinctio Cincinnato aranti nuntiatum est etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene et tempestive arare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 61, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos est enectus arando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">die septimo cessabis arare et metere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:34:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 34, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Cor. 9, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3715.3" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arare terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:703" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 703</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager non semel aratus, sed novatus et iteratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum terra araretur et sulcus altius esset impressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 23, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallem arari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campum arare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:328" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n3715.4" n="B" level="2"> Trop </sense><sense id="n3715.5" n="1" level="3"> Of a ship, <hi rend="ital">to plough</hi>: aequor. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 76</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 10, 33</bibl> Heins.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:780" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 780</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 495</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 36</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcare aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 707</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n3715.6" n="2" level="3"> Of age, <hi rend="ital">to draw furrows over the body</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to wrinkle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam venient rugae, quae tibi corpus arent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3715.7" n="3" level="3"> In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:48 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 48 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3715.8" n="4" level="3"> Prov.: arare litus, for <hi rend="ital">to bestow useless labor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non profecturis litora bobus aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 116</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 48</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3715.9" n="II" level="1"> In a more extended sense. </sense><sense id="n3715.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cultivate land</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol. to pursue agriculture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to live by husbandry</hi> (cf. agricola and arator): <cit><quote lang="la">quae homines arant, navigant, aedificant, virtuti omnia parent, i. e. in agriculturā, navigatione, etc., omnia ex virtute animi pendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 7</bibl></cit> Corte' arat Falerni mille fundi jugera, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives Romani, qui arant in Siciliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3715.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To gain by agriculture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to acquire by tillage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem medimna ex jugero arare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47</bibl></cit> (where, Zumpt, from conjecture, has received <hi rend="ital">exarare</hi> into the text; so B. and K.).</sense></entryFree>
aroma: <entryFree id="n3716" type="greek" key="a^ro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<case>dat.</case> and <sense id="n3716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> aromatibus, also aromatis, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4, 19</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. I. p. 291), = <foreign lang="greek">a)/rwma</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a spice;</hi> in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 8, 72; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Apoth. 826" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apoth. 826</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">spices</hi> (so only in Vulg.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:37:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 37, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 25, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 19, 40</bibl> et saepe.</sense></entryFree>
aromatarius: <entryFree id="n3717" type="main" key="a^ro_ma^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărōmătārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>aroma</etym>, <sense id="n3717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dealer in spices</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 114</bibl> and 4064.</sense></entryFree>
aromaticus: <entryFree id="n3718" type="greek" key="a^ro_ma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărōmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rwmatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">composed of spice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aromatic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragrant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 324</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aromatites: <entryFree id="n3719" type="greek" key="a^ro_ma^ti_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărōmătītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rwmati/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n3719.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone of the smell and color of myrrh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of amber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 145</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3719.1" n="II" level="1"> Aromatites vinum, <hi rend="ital">aromatic wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 15, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:107" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 16, 19, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aromatizo: <entryFree id="n3720" type="hapax" key="a^ro_ma^ti_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ărōmătīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rwmati/zw</foreign>, <cb n="ARRE" /> <sense id="n3720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smell of spices</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aromatizans odorem dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 24, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aroneus: <entryFree id="n3721" type="main" key="A^ro_ne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ărōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n3721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the high-priest Aaron</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 22, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aros: <entryFree id="n3722" type="foreign" key="a^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăron</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ărum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/ron</foreign>, <sense id="n3722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wake-robin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arum dracunculus Linn.: quod aron vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 96</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 16, 91, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arpi: <entryFree id="n3723" type="main" key="Arpi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arpi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Apulia</hi>, earlier called Argyripa (q. v.), now <hi rend="ital">Arpa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 104</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. II. 82 sq.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n3723.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv.: </sense><sense id="n3723.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Arpi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dasius Altinius Arpinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45</bibl></cit>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arpīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Arpi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3723.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ar-pānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Arpi</hi>, Front. Col.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arpāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Arpi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arpinum: <entryFree id="n3724" type="main" key="Arpi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arpīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Cicero and Marius</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Arpino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 8</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I. 676.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n3724.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv.: </sense><sense id="n3724.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arpīnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<case>nom.</case> Arpinatis, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 629</bibl> P.; cf. Ardeatis), <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Arpinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ar-pīnātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Arpinum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 21</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 15</bibl>; so also <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 571</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 11</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>: Arpinas (per antonomasiam) for <hi rend="ital">Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Carm. Ep. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Carm. Ep. 1, 1</bibl>; and for <hi rend="ital">Marius</hi>, the countryman of Cicero (cf. Arpinum), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 259</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3724.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Arpinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cicero's</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arpinus: <entryFree id="n3725" type="main" key="Arpi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n3725.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Arpi</hi>, v. Arpi.—</sense><sense id="n3725.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of Arpinum</hi>, v. Arpinum, II. B.</sense></entryFree>
arquatus: <entryFree id="n3726" type="main" key="arqua_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arquātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arquus = arcus = rainbow; v. arcus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>: morbus, <sense id="n3726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the jaundice</hi> (a disease in which the skin turns to the yellow color of the rainbow), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 24</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">arquātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one that has the jaundice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 425, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lurida praeterea flunt, quaecumque tuentur Arquati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:332 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 332 sq.</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 35, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 18</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 11, 44, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arquitenens: <entryFree id="n3727" type="main" key="Arqui^te^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arquĭtĕnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Arcitenens.</entryFree>
arquites: <entryFree id="n3728" type="gloss" key="arqui_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arquītes</orth> = sagittarii, <sense id="n3728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bowmen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">archers</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 20</bibl> Müll. [arquus = ar cus].</sense></entryFree>
arquus: <entryFree id="n3729" type="main" key="arquus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arquus</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. arcus.</entryFree>
arra: <entryFree id="n3730" type="main" key="arra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arra, arrabo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">arralis</orth>, v. arrha, arrhabo, arrhalis.</entryFree>
arrectarius: <entryFree id="n3731" type="main" key="arrecta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrectārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arrectus</etym>, <sense id="n3731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in an erect position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpendicular;</hi> hence, arrectaria, <hi rend="ital">the upright posts of a wall</hi> (opp. transversarii, cross-beams), only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>, and 7, 3.</sense></entryFree>
arrectus: <entryFree id="n3732" type="main" key="arrectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <pos>P. a.</pos>, from arrigo.</entryFree>
arrenicum: <entryFree id="n3733" type="greek" key="arre^ni^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrĕnĭcum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">arrh-, arsĕn-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rseniko/n</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">a)rreniko/n</foreign>), <sense id="n3733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">arsenic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orpiment.</hi> vitia cum chartā et arrhenico sanant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 15, 60, § 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:178" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 18, 56, § 178</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> uses for it auripigmentum).</sense></entryFree>
arrepo: <entryFree id="n3734" type="main" key="arre_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ar-rēpo</orth> (better, <orth extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>repsi, reptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n3734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to creep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">move slowly to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toward</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to steal softly to</hi>, lit. and trop.; constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad;</hi> post-Aug. with <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n3734.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mus aut lacerta ad columbaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubetae adrepentes foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3734.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: sensim atque moderate ad amicitiam adrepserat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 68</bibl>: leniter in spem Adrepe officiosus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui animis muliercularum adrepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultis libellis saevitiae principis adrepit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arrepticius: <entryFree id="n3735" type="main" key="arrepti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arreptīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arreptus</etym>, <sense id="n3735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seized</hi> in mind, <hi rend="ital">inspired</hi> (in eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n3735.1" n="I" level="1"> In bon. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sis dux in domo Domini super omnem virum arreptitium et prophetantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:29:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 29, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3735.2" n="II" level="1"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">raving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delirious</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 4 al.</sense></entryFree>
arrepto: <entryFree id="n3736" type="spur" key="arrepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrepto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, a false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 109</bibl>, instead of obreptantibus, v. Sillig ad h. l.</entryFree>
arreptus: <entryFree id="n3737" type="main" key="arreptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arreptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from arripio.</entryFree>
arretium: <entryFree id="n3738" type="main" key="Arre_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arrētĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. Aretium <pb n="165" /> <cb n="ARRI" /></entryFree>
arrha: <entryFree id="n3739" type="greek" key="arrha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">arrhăbo</orth> (also without aspiration <orth extent="full" lang="la">arra</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">arrăbo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (the latter form ante-class.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 21</bibl>; in Cic. the word is never used), = <foreign lang="greek">a)rrabw/n</foreign> [from the Heb. <foreign /> from <foreign />, to give security], <sense id="n3739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the money given to ratify a contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earnest-money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase-money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an earnest</hi> (<hi rend="ital">arrha</hi> is a part of the purchase-money, while <hi rend="ital">pignus</hi> is a pledge to be restored when the contract, for security of which it is given, Las been performed, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 5, 25</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n3739.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arraboni has dedit quadraginta minas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 22</bibl>: Ea relicta huic arrabonist pro illo argento, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 42</bibl>: tantus arrabo, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 20</bibl> (i. e. sexcentos obsides, Gell.): <cit><quote lang="la">dederis mihi arrabonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:38:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 38, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro arrabone dari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 38, 18</bibl></cit>.—Jestingly shortened into rabo: <cit><quote lang="la">rabonem habeto, mecum ut hanc noctem sies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:20 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 20 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3739.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrabo amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so ironically: mortis arra,</quote> <trans><tr>money given to physicians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arrhabo: <entryFree id="n3740" type="main" key="arrha^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrhăbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. arrha.</entryFree>
arrhalis: <entryFree id="n3741" type="hapax" key="arrha_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrhālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">arrāl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arrha</etym>, <sense id="n3741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a pledge</hi>: pactum, Diocl. Cod. 4, 49, 3.</sense></entryFree>
arrhenicum: <entryFree id="n3742" type="main" key="arrhe^ni^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrhĕnĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. arrenicum.</entryFree>
arrhenogonon: <entryFree id="n3743" type="greek" key="arrhe^no^go^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrhĕnŏgŏnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rreno/gonon</foreign>, <sense id="n3743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the plant</hi> satyrion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 63, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arrhetos: <entryFree id="n3744" type="greek" key="arrhe_tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrhētos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/rrhtos</foreign> (unutterable), <sense id="n3744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Æons of Valentinus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arria: <entryFree id="n3745" type="main" key="Arri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Pœtus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for her magnanimity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arrideo: <entryFree id="n3746" type="main" key="arri_de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ar-rīdĕo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>, Lachm., B. and K., Halm, K. and H.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">arr-</orth>, Fleck., Merk., Weissenb.), <itype>rīsi, rīsum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n3746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to laugh at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smile at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, especially approvingly. </sense><sense id="n3746.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <case>dat.</case>, more rarely with <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n3746.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non arriderent, dentis ut restringerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oportet lenam probam arridere Quisquis veniat, blandeque alloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quidam familiaris (Dionysii) jocans dixisset: huic (juveni) quidem certe vitam tuam committis, adrisissetque adulescens, utrumque jussit interfici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hic cum adrisisset ipse Crassus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 229</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cum risi, arrides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cum adrisissent, discessimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 42</bibl></cit>; so * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 14, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3746.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tum mi aedes quoque arridebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dentibus adrident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli laedere os, arridere omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix notis familiariter arridere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3746.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">video quid adriseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:28:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 28, 79</bibl></cit>: Cn. Flavius id adrisit, <hi rend="ital">laughed at this</hi>, Piso ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: vos nunc alloquitur, vos nunc adridet ocellis, Val. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author> Dir. 108</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3746.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si adriderentur, esset id ipsum Atticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 4, 11</bibl></cit> (B. and K., <hi rend="ital">riderentur</hi>). —</sense><sense id="n3746.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3746.7" n="A" level="2"> Subject., <hi rend="ital">to be favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindly disposed to one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tempestas adridet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quandoque mihi Fortunae adriserit hora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 133, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3746.8" n="B" level="2"> Object. (i. e. in reference to the effect produced), <hi rend="ital">to be pleasing to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to please</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhibere illud tuum, quod valde mihi adriserat, vehementer displicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus haec adridere velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arrigo: <entryFree id="n3747" type="main" key="arri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ar-rĭgo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>, <itype>Dietsch</itype>, Halm; <orth extent="full" lang="la">arr-</orth>, Fleck., Rib., Weissenb.), <itype>rexi, rectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rego</etym>, <sense id="n3747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi> (not used by Cic., but for it he employs erigere). </sense><sense id="n3747.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo comas arrexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 726</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 280</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 516</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 303</bibl> (translatio a pecudibus, Don. ad Ter. l. c.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. demittere aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 35</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:62:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 62, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollit se arrectum quadrupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:892" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 892</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 426</bibl>; 2, 206 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n3747.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to encourage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos non paulum oratione suā Marius adrexerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum spes arrectae juvenum,</quote> <trans><tr>when hope was aroused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrectae stimulis haud mollibus irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 452</bibl></cit>: Etruria atque omnes reliquiae belli adrectae,<cb n="ARRI" />  <hi rend="ital">are in commotion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">are roused</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:19, p. 220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 19, p. 220</bibl> Gerl.: <cit><quote lang="la">adrectā omni civitate,</quote> <trans><tr>excited with wonder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. arrigere aliquem or animos, <hi rend="ital">to incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse the mind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">courage to</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to direct to</hi> something (sometimes with ad aliquam rem): <cit><quote lang="la">vetus certamen animos adrexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 3</bibl></cit> Kritz: <cit><quote lang="la">sic animis eorum adrectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 68, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:86:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes">86, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrexere animos Itali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his animum arrecti dictis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 579</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrecti ad bellandum animi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 37</bibl></cit> (cf. erigo).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">arrectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">set upright;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitous</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque Alpium ab Italiā sicut breviora, ita arrectiora sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: saxa arrectiora, Sol. c. 14.</sense></entryFree>
arrilator: <entryFree id="n3748" type="gloss" key="arrila_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrilātor</orth>, v. arilator.</entryFree>
arripio: <entryFree id="n3749" type="main" key="arri^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ar-rĭpĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>, B. and K.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">arr-</orth>, Lachm., Ritschl, Fleck., Merk., Rib., K. and H., Weissenb., Halm), <itype>rĭpŭi, reptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rapio</etym>, <sense id="n3749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi> a person or thing <hi rend="ital">to</hi> one's self (esp. with haste). </sense><sense id="n3749.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n3749.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eum eriperet, manum arripuit mordicus: Vix foras me abripui atque effugi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the first of the words following, formed by Plaut. after the manner of Aristophanes: Quodsemelarripides Numquampostreddonides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:6:23" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 6, 23</bibl></cit> Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:Capt. 4:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 22, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Num. 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jud. 9, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum, vestimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus Arripit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:386" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pileum vel galerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum e strage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittam et scutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem barbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam comā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 552</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput capillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl></cit>: manum alicujus, Auct. B. G. 8, 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3749.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take to</hi> one's self, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arripe opem auxiliumque ad hanc rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox et gestus subito sumi et aliunde adripi non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:59:252" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 59, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognomen sibi ex Aeliorum imaginibus adripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non debes adripere maledictum ex trivio aut ex scurrarum aliquo convicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libenter adripere facultatem laedendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad reprehendendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:65:162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 65, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimentum pro occasione arripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3749.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3749.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sublimem medium arriperem, et capite pronum in terram statuerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul arripit ipsum Pendentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium arripit Servium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando arripuerit te spiritus Domini malus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 16, 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 8, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Existit sacer ignis et urit corpore serpens, Quamcumque arripuit partim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemcumque patrem familias adripuissetis ex aliquo circulo,</quote> <trans><tr>you might have taken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte eum (dolorem) dicis, qui simul atque adripuit, interficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Dan. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 27, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrepto repente equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes arreptas in urbem inducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 20</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the mind, <hi rend="ital">to seize upon with eagerness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to learn quickly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with avidity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri celeriter res innumerabiles adripiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (sc. Graecas litteras) quidem sic avide adripui, quasi diuturnam sitim explere cupiens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quarum studium etsi senior arripuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerit Socrates unde animum adripuerimus, si nullus fuerit in mundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod animus adriperet aut exciperet extrinsecus ex divinitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3749.6" n="B" level="2"> As a judicial t. t., <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">summon before a tribunal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to complain of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accuse</hi> (cf. rapio; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. of those who are complained of after leaving their office): eum te adripuisse, a quo non sis rogatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 22, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quaestionem ipse adreptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus plebis consules abeuntes magistratu arripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arreptus a P. Numitorio Sp. Oppius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arreptus a viatore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestor ejus in praejudicium aliquot criminibus arreptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Sejani conscios arreptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3749.7" n="C" level="2"> In Horace, <hi rend="ital">to attack with ridicule</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ridicule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satirize</hi>: Primores populi<cb n="ARRO" />  arripuit populumque tributim, Sat. 2, 1, 69: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriam et Nomentanum arripe mecum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 224</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arrisio: <entryFree id="n3750" type="hapax" key="arri_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrīsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arrideo</etym>, <sense id="n3750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smiling upon with approbation</hi>: alicujus adrisio, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arrisor: <entryFree id="n3751" type="hapax" key="arri_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrīsor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who smiles on another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a flatterer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fawner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultorum divitum arrosor, et (quod sequitur) adrisor, et, quod duobus his adjunctum est, derisor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arrodo: <entryFree id="n3752" type="main" key="arro_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ar-rōdo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>, <itype>Kayser</itype>, Jan), <itype>rōsi, rōsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gnaw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nibble at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gnaw</hi> (cf.: aduro, accendo, accīdo, adedo al.). </sense><sense id="n3752.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spartum, quod asellus adrodit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mures adrosis clipeis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina adrosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 30, 36, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues spirantes a muribus adrosas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 85, § 213</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3752.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ut illa ex vepreculis extracta nitedula rem publicam conaretur adrodere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecclesiasticas caulas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arrogans: <entryFree id="n3753" type="main" key="arro^gans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrŏgans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from arrogo.</entryFree>
arroganter: <entryFree id="n3754" type="main" key="arro^ganter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrŏganter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. arrogo, <sense id="n3754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
arrogantia: <entryFree id="n3755" type="main" key="arro^gantia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrŏgantia</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arrogans</etym>. <sense id="n3755.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An assuming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presumption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceitedness</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">superbia, insolentia, fastus): cum omnis adrogantia odiosa est, tum illa ingenii atque eloquentiae multo molestissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Crassus sine adrogantiā gravis esse videbatur et sine segnitiā verecundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:282" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 81, 282</bibl></cit>: illud <foreign lang="greek">gnw=qi seauto/n</foreign> noli putare ad adrogantiam minuendam solum esse dictum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 6, 7</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas tristi adrogantiā taedium sui moverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adrogantiā depravatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:18:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 18, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adrogantia tua decepit te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:49:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 49, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3755.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The proud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lordly bearing arising from a consciousness of real or supposed superiority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughtiness</hi> (cf. arrogans): <cit><quote lang="la">hujus adrogantiam pertinacia aequabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia et adrogantia praecipua validiorum vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiam et adrogantiam et avaritiam exuerat: nec illi, quod est rarissimum, aut facilitas auctoritatem aut severitas amorem deminuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magnitudinem et gravitatem summae fortunae retineret, invidiam et adrogantiam effugerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adrogantia ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:48:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 48, 29</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n3755.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pertinacity in one's demands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinacy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cessurosque se potius adrogantiae Antipatri quam etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
arrogatio: <entryFree id="n3756" type="main" key="arro^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrŏgātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>arrogo</etym>, <sense id="n3756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking to</hi> one's self; hence, as jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the full adoption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the</hi> comitia curiata <hi rend="ital">in the presence of the</hi> pontifices, <hi rend="ital">later of the emperor himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a</hi> homo sui juris <hi rend="ital">in the place of a child</hi> (cf. s. v. adoptio and the authors there cited): <cit><quote lang="la">adrogatio dicta, quia genus hoc in alienam familiam transitus per populi rogationem fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adrogatio dicitur, quia et is, qui adoptat rogatur, id est interrogatur, an velit eum, quem adoptaturus sit, justum sibi filium esse, et is qui adoptatur, rogatur, an id fieri patiatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudius Tiberius Nero in Augusti liberos e privigno redactus adrogatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arrogator: <entryFree id="n3757" type="main" key="arro^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrŏgātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that adopts</hi> one in the place of a child (cf. arrogatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:19" default="NO">1, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:22" default="NO">1, 7, 22</bibl>; 1, 7, 40.</sense></entryFree>
arrogo: <entryFree id="n3758" type="main" key="arro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ar-rŏgo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>, Fleck., B. and K., Dietsch, Halm, Weissenb.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">arr-</orth>, <itype>Holder</itype>, Dinter; Keller uses both forms), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n3758.0" n="I" level="1"> Jurid. and polit. t. t. </sense><sense id="n3758.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To ask</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inquire of one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to question</hi>: Venus haec volo adroget te, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 45</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n3758.2" n="B" level="2"> Alicui, t. t., <hi rend="ital">to add one officer to another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to associate with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place by the side of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui consuli dictatorem adrogari haud satis decorum visum est patribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 25, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3758.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take a</hi> homo sui juris <hi rend="ital">in the place of a child</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to adopt</hi> (v. arrogatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:2" default="NO">1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:22 al" default="NO">1, 7, 22 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3758.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3758.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To appropriate</hi> that which does not belong to one, <hi rend="ital">to claim as one's own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to arrogate to one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam mihi non sumo tantum, judices, neque adrogo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim mihi tantum derogo, tametsi nihil adrogo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiam sibi adrogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:292" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 85, 292</bibl></cit>: ego tantum tibi tribuo, <pb n="166" /> <cb n="ARS" /> quantum mihi fortasse arrogo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quod ex alienā virtute sibi adrogant, id mihi ex meā non concedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nihil adrogabo mihi nobilitatis aut modestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nec sibi cenarum quivis temere arroget artem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3758.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: alicui aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to adjudge something to another as his own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to confer upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">procure for</hi> (opp. abrogare): <cit><quote lang="la">Scire velim, chartis pretium quotus adroget annus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus arrogavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil non arroget armis,</quote> <trans><tr>adjudge every thing to arms</tr>, <tr>think every thing must yield to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 121</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">arrŏgans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, acc. to II. A., <hi rend="ital">appropriating</hi> something not one's own; hence, <hi rend="ital">assuming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogant</hi> (syn.: superbus, insolens, ferox). </sense><sense id="n3758.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si essent adrogantes, non possem ferre fastidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Induciomarus iste minax atque adrogans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne arrogans in praeripiendo populi beneficio videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigritia adrogantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adrogantissima persuasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Decl. 8, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3758.8" n="B" level="2"> As a consequence of assumption, <hi rend="ital">haughty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overbearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolent</hi> (cf. arrogantia, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">proponit inania mihi nobilitatis, hoc est hominum adrogantium nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de se persuasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitas adrogans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus superiores tristi adulatione, adrogans minoribus, inter pares difficilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem adrogantem humilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abominatio Domino est omnis adrogans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Prov. 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beatos dicimus adrogantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,047:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Mal. 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">arrŏgan-ter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">with assumption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughtily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proudly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 339</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid praejudicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: adversarios sustinere, D. Brutus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 4</bibl>: ingredi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,044:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Soph. 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere in deditos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo adrogantius factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolentius et adrogantius uti gloriā artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 10, 36, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adrogantius et elatius praefari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
